title: Is Trump the First President in 100 Years Not To Have a Dog?
subtitle: The White House has had a long and interesting history of four-legged residents.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump is the first president in a 100 years not to have a dog.

title: Is This Image of Obama With a Fly Near His Lip Real?
subtitle: Vice President Mike Pence is not the first politician to be bugged by the bothersome housefly.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows U.S. President Barack Obama with a fly near his lip.

title: Did Pence Dismiss the Idea of Systemic Racism?
subtitle: During a debate with Sen. Kamala Harris, the vice president made some conflicting statements about systemic racism in America.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence balked at the idea that "America is systemically racist" during a debate with Democratic nominee Sen. Kamala Harris, a Black woman.

title: Did Kennedy, Nixon Have a Virtual Debate in 1960?
subtitle: Being in the same room is not mandatory to have a meaningful discussion of the issues.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. presidential candidates John F. Kennedy and Richard Nixon participated in a virtual debate in 1960.

title: Was a Hollywood-Style Trump Sign Erected in Los Angeles?
subtitle: The five letters were displayed on private property, and their owner's identity is not known.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A large "TRUMP" sign, similar to the iconic Hollywood sign, was erected near Los Angeles in October 2020.

title: Did Gay Men Take Over the #ProudBoys Hashtag on Social Media?
subtitle: Photographs of LBGTQ love flooded Twitter in an attempt to drown out the white supremacist organization.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Gay men reclaimed the hashtag #ProudBoys from the white supremacist organization of the same name in order to celebrate LBGTQ love.

title: Did Biden Claim 6,114 Military COVID-19 Deaths When There Were 7?
subtitle: During a September 2020 address, U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden stumbled over figures related to COVID-19 military deaths.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: While at a Michigan campaign event in September 2020, U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden incorrectly stated that there had been 6,114 "military COVID deaths" and 118,984 "military COVID [infections]." There had been only seven.

title: Did Federal Food Aid Boxes Include White House Letter Crediting Trump?
subtitle: More than 100 million food aid boxes were distributed across the United States in 2020 in response to the Coronavirus pandemic.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: In late September 2020, the U.S. Department of Agriculture distributed millions of federally funded aid boxes that included a letter from President Donald Trump crediting his administration for their distribution.

title: Did Trump Campaign Send Fundraising Emails With the Date 'September 31st'?
subtitle: The emails were sent on the day after September 30, so we can see where the confusion arose.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: On Oct. 1, 2020, the re-election campaign of U.S. President Donald Trump sent fundraising emails with the date "September 31st."

title: Were Trays of Mail, Including Mail-In Ballots, Found in a Ditch?
subtitle: The U.S. Postal Service has been under fire for several problems concerning mail-in ballots in 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Three trays of mail, including several mail-in ballots, were found in a ditch along a highway in Wisconsin in September 2020.

title: Did Bloomberg Pay Fines for 31,000 Florida Felons So They Can Vote?
subtitle: Under Florida law, some convicted felons may have their voting rights reinstated if they fulfill all requirements - including monetary - of their court-ordered sentencing.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Billionaire and former presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg raised more than $16 million to pay the fines and restitution of convicted felons in Florida so that they are able to register to vote ahead of the 2020 general election.

title: Was Justice Ginsburg the First Woman To Lie in State at the US Capitol?
subtitle: The late justice was the second woman appointed to the U.S. Supreme Court and was described as a pioneer for women's rights.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Shortly after her death on Sept. 18, 2020, U.S. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg became the first woman in American history to lie in state at the U.S. Capitol.

title: Did Trump Try To Deflect Attention From His COVID-19 Response by Criticizing Obama's to H1N1?
subtitle: Within a year of the first confirmed H1N1 case in the U.S, more than 69 million people had been infected, resulting in more than 12,000 deaths.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tried to deflect attention from his response to the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic by repeatedly comparing it to President Barack Obama's handling of the H1N1 pandemic.

title: Does Texting 'RBG' to 50409 Send a Letter to Your Senators?
subtitle: The automated political advocacy service Resistbot ran another campaign following the death of U.S. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg in September 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Texting "RBG" to 50409 engages a service called "Resistbot" and generates an email encouraging a delayed vote on a new Supreme Court justice, which is sent to a user's U.S. senators.

title: Did the 'Benadryl Challenge' Prompt Warnings of Overdose Risk?
subtitle: The internet dare that went viral in 2020 joined a long list of dangerous challenges that have targeted teenagers on social media.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: The so-called “Benadryl Challenge” went viral on TikTok in 2020, challenging teenagers to overdose on the allergy medication to elicit hallucinatory effects, prompting warnings from medical experts over the potential risk of overdose death.

title: Did the Trump Campaign's 'Support Our Troops' Ad Feature Russian Jets?
subtitle: It's often difficult to make out the specifics of an intentionally generic image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A "Support Our Troops" ad from the 2020 Trump campaign featured an image of Russian fighter jets.

title: Is Patagonia's 'Vote the Assholes Out' Clothing Tag Real?
subtitle: The tags reportedly can be found on the company's Regenerative Organic Stand-Up Shorts.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Patagonia clothing tag that reads, "Vote the Assholes Out."

title: Did the Trump Administration Withhold Money from FDNY 9/11 Health Fund?
subtitle: The COVID-19 pandemic has made it harder for a cash-strapped New York City to front the costs of the 9/11 program.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Trump administration withheld money from a program that covers medical care for sick and injured 9/11 first responders.

title: Do Photos Really Show Red Skies Over Oregon?
subtitle: Wildfires in the Pacific Northwest caused some surreal scenes in 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs and videos show a blood-red sky over Oregon in late summer 2020.

title: Did US Rep. Wear 'Kill 'Em All' Shirt to GOP Event?
subtitle: The communications director for the Colorado Republican Party told Snopes the saying is well-known as being associated with the U.S. Marines.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: U.S. Rep. Ken Buck, a Republican from Colorado, attended a campaign rally wearing a T-shirt that read, “Kill 'Em All. Let God Sort 'Em Out.”

title: Did 27 Republicans Take the 'Unprecedented' Step of Endorsing Biden?
subtitle: The 2020 Democratic presidential candidate obtained support from some high-profile GOP figures.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2020, 27 former Republican members of Congress endorsed Joe Biden for President of the United States.

title: Did Marjorie Taylor Greene Pose With a Gun in Front of an Image of 'The Squad'?
subtitle: A QAnon supporter and congressional candidate's Facebook post was removed for violating the social network's policies.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Congressional candidate Marjorie Taylor Greene shared an image of herself posing with a gun in front of an image of "The Squad" on Facebook.

title: Did a GOP Candidate Tweet Praise for Accused Kenosha Shooter?
subtitle: The conservative commentator used her Twitter account to praise a murder suspect while insulting an environmental activist.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: GOP congressional candidate DeAnna Lorraine tweeted praise for accused Kenosha shooter Kyle Rittenhouse.

title: Did Pelosi Visit Hair Salon Closed Due to COVID-19?
subtitle: This hair appointment engendered widespread controversy in summer of 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2020, U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi had a hair appointment at a salon in San Francisco - at a time when hair salons were forbidden to operate in the city due to COVID-19.

title: Did Chicago Code Blue FB Page Post a Meme Mocking Jacob Blake?
subtitle: The Facebook page for supporters of law enforcement has a history of posting controversial content.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Chicago Code Blue Facebook page shared a meme mocking Jacob Blake, who was paralyzed after being shot in the back by a police officer in Wisconsin in August 2020.

title: Did RNC Attendees Forgo Masks And Social Distancing?
subtitle: Masks - or lack thereof - at the Republican convention became a point of political partisanship during the 2020 presidential election.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Hundreds of people at the 2020 Republican National Convention in Washington, D.C., ignored mask-wearing and social-distancing recommendations as Trump officially accepted the Republican nomination.

title: Did Christian Crowdfunding Campaign Raise Money for Kyle Rittenhouse?
subtitle: Rittenhouse, 17, is accused of killing two people at a protest against police brutality in Kenosha, Wisconsin, on Aug. 25, 2020.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: A crowdfunding campaign on the Christian site GiveSendGo solicited donations to help Kyle Rittenhouse, a 17-year-old accused of killing two people at a protest in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

title: Did Kenosha Police Give Water to Teen Later Charged With Double Homicide?
subtitle: Police can be heard on a loudspeaker saying, "We appreciate you guys," during counterprotests following the police shooting of a Black man in Kenosha.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Police in Kenosha, Wisconsin, gave water to Kyle Rittenhouse, the teen later charged with killing two people and wounding a third during protests over the police shooting of Jacob Blake, and said they "appreciated" the counterprotesters.

title: Did RNC Video Depict Rioting in 'Biden's America' Using Barcelona Footage?
subtitle: Also, wouldn't any footage showing 2020 protests in the U.S. be more accurately labeled "Trump's America"?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video clip from Barcelona was shown at the Republican National Convention (RNC) to depict violence in "Biden's America."

title: Was Kenosha Corrections Building Destroyed in Protests?
subtitle: Activist Shaun King shared a video of smoke rising from what he said was an entirely "burned down" Department of Corrections compound.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: During protests following the police shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha, Wisconsin, a Kenosha facility run by the state Department of Corrections was set on fire and completely destroyed.

title: Was Kamala Harris Called 'Hoe' on Car Dealer's Billboard?
subtitle: The sign was referring to the California U.S. senator who made history as the first Black woman on a major political party's presidential ticket.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2020, a car dealership in Massachusetts erected a billboard referring to 2020 U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden and his vice-presidential nominee, Kamala Harris, as "Joe and the Hoe."

title: Did Kyle Rittenhouse Attend a Trump Rally?
subtitle: The 17-year-old charged with first-degree intentional homicide after two protesters were killed in Kenosha, Wisconsin, posted on social media in support of Blue Lives Matter and President Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kyle Rittenhouse, the 17-year-old accused of killing two people at a protest in Wisconsin, attended a rally for President Trump.

title: Is This an Excerpt from Hitler's Psychological Profile?
subtitle: "In each and every field, [Hitler] believes himself to be an unquestioned authority," the report stated.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme reproduces a portion of a psychological profile of Adolf Hitler commissioned by the U.S. Office of Strategic Services (OSS).

title: Did a Walmart Customer's Change Get Donated Without Consent?
subtitle: The nationwide coin shortage in 2020 caused retailers to implement policies on change that occasionally confused cashiers and customers.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In July 2020, a Walmart customer in Massachusetts had the change from her purchase donated to charity without her consent.

title: Did a Netflix Film Poster Sexualize Young Girls?
subtitle: "Cuties," an award-winning French film about a group of young dancers, gained attention for all the wrong reasons in 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In August 2020, Netflix released a film poster that portrayed young girls in what many viewers perceived as a sexualized manner.

title: Does 'The Beast' Use Goodyear Tires?
subtitle: Controversy fall flat? The internet always has a spare.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The U.S. presidential limo is equipped with Goodyear tires.

title: Does Texting 'USPS' to 50409 Send a Letter to Your Political Representatives?
subtitle: A political crisis surrounding the Postal Service inspired some novel campaigning techniques in August 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Texting "USPS" to 50409 engages a service called "Resistbot" and generates a letter of support for the Postal Service that is sent to a user's political representatives.

title: Is This a 327-Pound Halibut?
subtitle: The world's largest flatfish can weigh more than 500 pounds.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a fisherman with a 327-pound halibut.

title: Did LA Sheriff's Deputies Point Guns at Teenage Assault Victims?
subtitle: The encounter was recorded ... and then the footage went viral.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: While responding to a 911 assault report, Los Angeles County sheriff's deputies pointed firearms at teenagers - two of whom were Black - after witnesses said the teens themselves were the victims of an attack by a knife-wielding man.

title: Did Trump Donate to Kamala Harris' Past Election Campaigns?
subtitle: Trump's reelection campaign called Harris "a corrupt former California Attorney General." But did he play a small role in keeping her in that office?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump donated $6,000 to Kamala Harris' 2014 campaign for reelection as California attorney general.

title: Could People Be Jailed, Fined for Refusing COVID-19 Vaccine in US?
subtitle: Even without a COVID-19 vaccine yet available, readers asked whether individuals who refused one could face criminal penalties.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Individual U.S. states would be legally authorized to impose criminal penalties on individuals who refused to undergo a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination.

title: Did Trump Criticize Obama Because He Was 'Unable to Negotiate with Congress'?
subtitle: The president attempted to circumvent Congress in August 2020 to provide coronavirus relief in the absence of a broad agreement with Congress.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump criticized then U.S. President Barack Obama in 2014 for "subverting the Constitution of the U.S. because he is unable to negotiate with Congress."

title: Has Trump Suggested He Wants His Image on Mount Rushmore?
subtitle: Apparently the U.S. president has discussed the subject in both seriousness and in jest.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump has suggested he wants his image added to Mount Rushmore.

title: Did The Satanic Temple Sue Over Missouri Abortion Law?
subtitle: A member's lawsuit against a Missouri abortion rule opened up a significant debate.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A member of The Satanic Temple filed a lawsuit in 2018 arguing that a Missouri law that requires a woman seeking an abortion to receive a pamphlet asserting that life begins at conception violated her religious beliefs.

title: Does a Photograph Show Jerry Falwell, Jr. with His Pants Unzipped?
subtitle: Falwell said the picture was intended to be a joke.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows evangelical Liberty University president Jerry Falwell, Jr. posing next to a woman with his pants unzipped.

title: Was This Dog's Face Burned in a Fire?
subtitle: A similar picture circulated years earlier.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a dog that suffered burns on its face after escaping a house fire.

title: Is This Email About a Google Plus Settlement Real?
subtitle: If you were a Google Plus user between 2015 and early 2019, you could receive compensation from this class action lawsuit.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: According to an August 2020 email, some former Google Plus users were eligible for a cash payment from a 2018 lawsuit settlement after a software issue exposed the private data of up to half a million users of the social network.

title: Did Portland Protesters Burn Bibles and American Flags?
subtitle: The allegations come after more than two months of escalating protests in downtown Portland, Oregon.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Protesters In Portland, Oregon, burned American flags and Bibles during anti-racism protests in the summer of 2020.

title: Did Biden Staffers Contribute to a Protester-Bailout Fund?
subtitle: Following the arrests of anti-police-brutality protesters, a bailout assistance organization received more than $20 million in donations over four days.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Campaign staffers for U.S. Democratic 2020 presidential candidate Joe Biden contributed to a bailout fund for protesters arrested after the police in-custody death of George Floyd.

title: Did Obituary Blame Trump for Man's COVID-19 Death?
subtitle: An emotional obituary for David W. Nagy condemned all who have failed to heed the advice of medical professionals during the 2020 coronavirus pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The obituary for David W. Nagy blamed his death on U.S. President Trump, Texas Gov. Greg Abbott, and "other politicians who did not take this pandemic seriously."

title: Does Video Show Toddlers Holding Profane Signs at Protest?
subtitle: Children in Portland, Oregon, were captured on video using four-letter words during protests against police brutality.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Video shows young children saying "Fuck the police" and holding signs that read “Fuck the police” and “Eff Trump goons” during protests against police brutality in Portland, Oregon, in July 2020.

title: Is the Camera That Recorded Police Beating Rodney King Up for Auction?
subtitle: The owner of the camera, George Holliday, filmed the beating from his balcony in 1991.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The video camera George Holliday used to film Los Angeles police officers beating Rodney King in 1991 is being auctioned off.

title: Did a Couple Wear Swastika Masks to Walmart?
subtitle: It was not the first such incident reported during the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: On July 25, 2020, a couple wore swastika face masks while shopping at a Walmart store in Minnesota.

title: Did Reagan Foundation Tell Trump Campaign to Stop Using His Likeness for Fundraising?
subtitle: A fundraising email advertised a coin with Reagan's likeness on it.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Reagan Foundation asked the Trump campaign and Republican National Committee to stop using Ronald Reagan's likeness on a fundraiser coin.

title: Did 13 'Nuns' Die of COVID-19 at a US Convent?
subtitle: An outbreak at a Felician convent in Michigan spread quickly.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Thirteen Felician sisters from one convent died from COVID-19.

title: Did a Viewer Spot This TV Reporter's Cancer?
subtitle: A handful of television personalities have been diagnosed with cancer after receiving a tip from viewers.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: A news reporter in Florida was diagnosed with cancer after a viewer spotted a lump in her throat during a broadcast.

title: Did Fauci Lower His Mask at a Baseball Game?
subtitle: The White House Coronavirus Task Force leader has been highly scrutinized throughout the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Dr. Anthony Fauci at a baseball game with his mask lowered below his mouth.

title: Did Trump Admin Memo Explain How To Spot Transgender People?
subtitle: A federal memo allegedly said homeless shelters could identify some incoming transgender residents based on height and whether or not they had facial hair or Adam's apples.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: The Trump administration issued a memo in July 2020 that listed physical characteristic to look for in order to identify incoming transgender people at federally funded homeless shelters.

title: Did Trump Wish Ghislaine Maxwell Well During a Briefing?
subtitle: The claims circulated after a July 2020 White House press briefing on COVID-19.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: During a White House press briefing regarding COVID-19, U.S. President Donald Trump said that he knew Ghislaine Maxwell and wished her well.

title: Did a Trump Campaign Ad Use a Photo from Ukraine of Protesters Hitting Police?
subtitle: The United States is not the only country that has seen violent clashes between police and protesters.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A campaign advertisement on U.S. President Donald Trump's official Facebook account presented an old photograph from Ukraine as if it showed violence against police officers in the United States.

title: Did Photographs Show a Naked Woman Protesting in Portland?
subtitle: A female protester dubbed "Naked Athena" prompted social media posts and news articles in July 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A naked woman protested on the streets of Portland in July 2020.

title: Does a Video Show a Real Yellow Turtle?
subtitle: The lemon-hued reptile looks like something straight out of a sci-fi movie.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: A video showed a rare, yellow turtle discovered in India in July 2020.

title: Did Trump Decry Low-Flow Showers and Dishwashers During a Pandemic?
subtitle: President Trump ranted about low-flow showers and dishwashers at a campaign rally-like event while the U.S. recorded a record high of COVID-19 cases in a single day.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump gave a talk during the COVID-19 pandemic in which he remonstrated about showers and dishwashers not functioning properly due to low-flow standards.

title: Is This McDonald's COVID-19 Sign Real?
subtitle: The Province of New Brunswick declared a state of emergency and issued a mandatory order in response to the threat posed by COVID-19.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A McDonald's sign requiring that all customers provide their names and phone numbers for collection is real.

title: Did an Ohio Man Die of COVID-19 After Vowing Not To Wear a Face Mask?
subtitle: The tragic death of 37-year-old Richard Rose attracted headlines around the world in the summer of 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Richard Rose of Port Clinton, Ohio died of COVID-19 after earlier vowing not to buy a face mask and dismissing advice to use face masks as "hype."

title: Did Trump Promote Goya Foods from the Oval Office?
subtitle: The president's social media post raised hackles among anti-corruption experts.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump promoted Goya brand foods from his desk in the Oval Office.

title: Did Trump Admin Remove CDC as Overseer of COVID-19 Hospital Data?
subtitle: In what was framed as an effort to streamline the reporting process, the federal government ordered hospitals to send patient information to a centralized database operated by HHS.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: In July 2020, U.S. President Donald Trump's administration established new guidelines for hospitals to report COVID-19 patient information that eliminates the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) as the leader of data collection.

title: Did Ivanka Trump Advertise Goya Products?
subtitle: The President's eldest daughter and adviser lobbed a bomb in the Twitter war of words over Goya.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Ivanka Trump advertised for Goya products.

title: Does Video Show Ants in a Standoff with Termites?
subtitle: A widely circulated video shows what appears to be two lines of ants and termites facing off in defensive postures.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: A video shows two lines of ants and termites positioned to defend their respective workers.

title: Did Chuck Woolery Say His Son Tested Positive for COVID-19?
subtitle: The former game show host had previously said that the CDC, doctors, Democrats, and the media were lying about COVID-19.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chuck Woolery wrote on Twitter that his son had tested positive for COVID-19.

title: Did a Colorado Squirrel Test Positive for Bubonic Plague?
subtitle: Experts caution that the incident is not cause for immediate concern.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: A squirrel in a rural Colorado town tested positive for bubonic plague in July 2020.

title: Is This Roger Stone and Proud Boys Flashing a White Power Symbol?
subtitle: According to the Anti-Defamation League, white nationalists started to appropriate the common "OK" hand gesture in 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Roger Stone and members of the Proud Boys flashing a white power symbol.

title: Are Rare 'Night-Shining' Clouds an Indicator of Climate Change?
subtitle: An increased occurrence of rare night clouds appears linked to rising levels of greenhouse gases.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Evidence shows rare night clouds are linked to human-caused climate change.

title: Do Grocery Store Receipts Contain Chemicals Linked to Cancer, Infertility?
subtitle: Grocery store receipts are thought to contain chemicals linked to hormone-related health issues.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Some grocery store receipts contain chemicals linked to infertility and hormone-related cancers.

title: Is This Deep-Sea Strawberry Squid Real?
subtitle: An iridescent berry-like cephalopod has everyone asking: Are you squidding me?
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Marine scientists have captured a specimen of a deep-sea “strawberry squid.”

title: Was a Statue of Melania Trump Set on Fire in Slovenia?
subtitle: A wooden likeness of the first lady was torched during the 2020 Fourth of July weekend.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A statue of first lady Melania Trump in her native country of Slovenia was damaged in a fire during the 2020 Independence Day weekend in the United States.

title: Did an Armed Black Militia March Through a Georgia State Park?
subtitle: A Confederate monument became the site of another protest on the Fourth of July 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: On July 4, 2020, around 1,000 heavily armed members of a Black militia marched through Georgia's Stone Mountain Park and demonstrated at the site of a monument depicting Confederate leaders.

title: Was Suspect in Slaying of 7-Year-old Girl Released on Bail Hours Before Her Shooting?
subtitle: Aaliyah Norris died two days after suffering a single gunshot wound to the head while sitting in a car in Forest City, North Carolina.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Shaquille Marshon Francis, charged in the murder of Aaliyah Norris, was released from jail in an unrelated case some three hours before her shooting.

title: Did Kanye West Wear a Confederate Flag Patch?
subtitle: The rapper and entrepreneur said that he wanted to re-appropriate the flag.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Kanye West wearing a jacket with a Confederate flag patch.

title: Did Trump Say Foreigners Attending College in the US 'Should Not Be Thrown Out'?
subtitle: At some universities, international students account for a third of the undergraduate student body, and they represent the majority of students in many graduate programs.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump tweeted that foreigners attending college in the United States who want to stay 'should not be thrown out of our country.'

title: Did a Nationwide US Coin Shortage Occur in Summer 2020?
subtitle: The COVID-19 pandemic was blamed for removing coins from circulation, as well as slowing production by the U.S. Mint.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic caused a nationwide shortage of U.S. coins in circulation during the summer of 2020.

title: Are These Images of Donald Trump and Ghislaine Maxwell Real?
subtitle: Socialite Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on sex abuse charges connected to convicted pedophile Jeffrey Epstein.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs and videos show President Trump and Ghislaine Maxwell together.

title: Are California Dems Trying to Change the Name of John Wayne Airport?
subtitle: The small airport in Orange County, California, has borne the name of the Western film star since 1979.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Democratic leaders in Orange County, California, are trying to change the name of John Wayne Airport.

title: Did a Couple Dubbed 'Ken and Karen' Point Guns at Protesters?
subtitle: A chaotic scene in St. Louis sparked outrage, memes, and confusion.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows two people waving guns at protesters in front of their home.

title: Are These Elijah McClain's Last Words on Police Video?
subtitle: In August 2019, a 23-year-old unarmed Black man died after an encounter with police officers in Aurora, Colorado.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A piece of text accurately transcribes the last words of Elijah McClain in a video recording of his encounter with police officers before he died in August 2019.

title: Is This a Real Transcript from a Trump Interview with Hannity?
subtitle: The president failed to articulate a single second-term priority or goal for his administration.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A transcript accurately reproduces an exchange from an interview between Fox News' Sean Hannity and U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Was a Stevie Ray Vaughan Statue Vandalized in Texas?
subtitle: The incident in 2020 wasn't the first time the statue had been defaced.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows graffiti on a Stevie Ray Vaughan statue in Texas in 2020.

title: Are These Troops Guarding the Lincoln Memorial?
subtitle: One striking photograph highlighted the political unrest taking place in the U.S. capital and across the country following the death of George Floyd.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows troops guarding the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C.

title: Is Rhode Island Dropping 'Plantation' from State Name?
subtitle: A movement to change the state's official name was reinvigorated by nationwide protests against racism in June 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The state of Rhode Island is moving to drop the word "Plantation" from its official name.

title: Did University Drop 'Gator Bait' Cheer Over Its Historical Connection to Racist Imagery?
subtitle: A national reckoning over racism and police brutality against Black people has bled into university sports, including in Florida.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: University of Florida dropped its “Gator Bait” cheer used at sporting events due to the phrase's invocation of a history of racist imagery of Black children being used as "alligator bait."

title: Does This Video Show Raz Simone Handing Out Guns in Seattle's CHOP?
subtitle: The rapper had been described by some as the "leader" of the Capitol Hill Organized Protest (CHOP) during anti-police-brutality protests in Seattle in spring 2020.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A video shows a "leader" of the Capitol Hill Organized Protest (CHOP), Raz Simone, giving a semi-automatic weapon to a fellow protester.

title: Does This iPhone Shortcut Allow Recording of Police Interactions?
subtitle: Siri became a popular accountability tool in 2020 amid growing attention on police brutality involving Black Americans.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Saying, "Hey Siri, I'm getting pulled over" enables a shortcut on your iPhone to record police interactions.

title: Is This a Burnt-Out Car From Police-Brutality Protests in Minneapolis?
subtitle: More than 1,500 buildings across the Twin Cities were vandalized, looted, or had doors or windows smashed in the month following George Floyd's death while in police custody.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a burnt-out car amidst the wreckage of protests in Minneapolis following the May 2020 death of George Floyd.

title: Is This 'I'm Sorry I'm Late. I Had a Lot To Learn' Protest Sign Real?
subtitle: The Black Lives Matter supporter told us: "I hope it lets people know that it's OK to change your opinion when you're presented with new evidence that clearly shows you were wrong."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a demonstrator at a June 2020 Black Lives Matter protest in Bethel, Ohio, holding a sign reading, "I'm Sorry I'm Late. I Had a Lot To Learn."

title: Was 'Terminator 2' Villain Created as a Commentary on Policing?
subtitle: Director James Cameron said, "The 'Terminator' films are not really about the human race getting killed off by future machines."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Film director James Cameron said that he chose a cop for the villain of "Terminator 2" in part because "cops think of all non-cops as less than they are."

title: Did Trump Tweet a Doctored Video of a 'Racist Baby'?
subtitle: The fake video joked that the baby must be a Trump supporter.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In June 2020, U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted a doctored video with a manipulated CNN chyron of a supposedly "racist baby" chasing a Black toddler.

title: Did George Floyd Protesters Deface the Statue of an Abolitionist?
subtitle: Matthias Baldwin was an outspoken critic of slavery decades before the onset of the U.S. Civil War.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Persons protesting the police-custody death of George Floyd defaced a statue of an abolitionist in Philadelphia.

title: Do Tulsa Trump Rally Attendees Have To Sign COVID-19 Waiver?
subtitle: The Trump campaign announced a rally at the same time public health officials recommended that people avoid big gatherings.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: The reelection campaign for U.S. President Donald Trump required attendees reserving tickets for a June 20, 2020, rally in Tulsa to agree they will not sue the campaign or event organizers should they be exposed to COVID-19 at the event.

title: Was This Lung Removed from a COVID-19 Patient?
subtitle: A patient in Chicago was so sick she had to receive a double-lung transplant.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the damage to a person's lung from the COVID-19 coronavirus disease.

title: Will Elmer Fudd and Yosemite Sam No Longer Carry Guns?
subtitle: Looney Tunes gets updated for HBO Max - with plenty of its signature outlandish violence.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Elmer Fudd and Yosemite Sam will no longer carry guns in the new Looney Tunes Cartoons series.

title: Are 'Blue Lives Murder' Shirts Available to Buy on Amazon?
subtitle: Social media users asked whether memes about the alleged shirts were factual.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: "Blue Lives Murder" shirts can be purchased on Amazon.

title: Did Melinda Gates Say This About Black People and COVID-19 Vaccination?
subtitle: A meme alleged she said Black Americans "must be" first in line for a vax, just behind heath care workers.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Melinda Gates said Black people should be first in line, after health care workers, to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Is This a Pic of a 'Beheaded' Christopher Columbus Statue?
subtitle: The photo of the explorer surfaced in early June 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a statue of Christopher Columbus that was "beheaded."

title: Was 'Gone With the Wind' Actress Hattie McDaniel Forced to Sit in the Back at the Oscars?
subtitle: She was the first Black woman to win an Academy Award for her portrayal of "Mammy" in the movie.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Black actress Hattie McDaniel was not allowed to sit with her white co-stars during the Academy Awards ceremony in 1940.

title: Did Jerry Falwell Tweet a Racist Photo?
subtitle: Jerry Falwell Jr., president of the evangelical Christian Liberty University, is under fire for a tweet criticizing Virginia's governor.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Liberty University President Jerry Falwell Jr. tweeted a racist photograph showing one person in blackface and another in a Ku Klux Klan outfit.

title: Are These New Zealanders Celebrating the End of COVID-19 Restrictions?
subtitle: In June 2020, New Zealand lifted all social distancing restrictions related to the COVID-19 pandemic after going two weeks without a confirmed case.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of people celebrating the end of COVID-19 restrictions in New Zealand.

title: Did Trump Say 'There's Many Per Capitas'?
subtitle: "Per capita" means the average per person and is often used in place of "per person" in statistical observances.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: In responding to a question about per capita coronavirus testing, President Trump asserted "there's many per capitas" and questioned "per capita relative to what?"

title: Did Police Slash Tires at Minneapolis Protests?
subtitle: Social media posts showed someone slashed the tires on nearly all of the cars parked at a Minneapolis Kmart located near George Floyd protests.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Law enforcement officers in Minnesota slashed the tires of cars parked near demonstrations against police brutality in May 2020.

title: Is Tear Gas Banned for Use in Warfare?
subtitle: The use of tear gas by police against anti-police-brutality protesters in the spring of 2020 came under fierce scrutiny.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Tear gas is a chemical weapon banned in international law for use in warfare.

title: Is This 'Trump Army' Fundraising Email Real?
subtitle: The Trump campaign launched the "Army for Trump" website in March 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a fundraising email for the Trump campaign asking people to join the "Trump Army" to go fight the "liberal MOB."

title: Did Mitt Romney March with Demonstrators?
subtitle: Romney was likely the first Republican U.S. Senator to participate in ongoing civil rights protests in 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Sen. Mitt Romney participated in a June 7, 2020 civil rights protest.

title: Did Fox News Correlate Stock Market Performance with the Deaths of Black Men?
subtitle: The graphic was used to illustrate market reactions to historic periods of civil unrest.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A graphic shows a Fox News chart correlating the stock market's performance with the aftermath of the beating and deaths of black men.

title: Is This Minnesota AG Keith Ellison with 'Antifa Handbook'?
subtitle: Amid vague rumors about "antifa" infiltrating Black Lives Matter protests and inciting violence, critics resurrected an old tweet.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison once tweeted a picture of himself holding a book titled "Antifa: The Anti-Fascist Handbook."

title: In Search Results for 'Racist,' Does Trump Appear First on Twitter?
subtitle: Indeed, he did. We reached out to Twitter to find out why.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump was the first result for the term "racist" on Twitter under the "People" section in June 2020.

title: Did Asheville Police Destroy a Medic Tent Made for Protesters?
subtitle: The Asheville police chief later said the incident “embarrassed our city and our department.”
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Asheville police officers destroyed a medic tent and its supplies while enforcing a curfew during a protest against police brutality.

title: Did Officers Shoot at a Car After Being Told a Pregnant Woman Was Inside?
subtitle: The Denver Police Department is investigating the incident.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A video taken at a George Floyd protest in Denver on the night of May 29, 2020 shows police officers firing pepper balls at a car after the driver told them the passenger was pregnant.

title: Was Robert E. Lee Statue Spray-Painted During 2020 Protests?
subtitle: Criticism of police and white supremacy took many forms during the 2020 protests following the death of George Floyd.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a statue of U.S. Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee that was marked with graffiti during the 2020 George Floyd protests.

title: Did Laura Ingraham Say LeBron James Should 'Shut Up' and Drew Brees Can 'Have His View'?
subtitle: Fox News host Laura Ingraham appears to have changed her mind whether athletes should express political opinions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows two segments from Laura Ingraham's Fox News show in which she gives contrary opinions on athletes injecting themselves into matters of politics and race.

title: Is This Clip of Herman Munster Giving Life Lessons Real?
subtitle: The clip began circulating recently on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a genuine clip from the show "The Munsters" in which Herman Munster says: "The lesson I want you to learn is it doesn't matter what you look like ... what does matter is the size of your heart and the strength of your character."

title: Do Plainclothes NYPD Officers Wear Colored Arm Bands?
subtitle: The “color of the day” system was first instituted by the NYPD street crime unit in the 1970s.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Plainclothes New York City police officers wear colored arm bands to identify themselves to other police officers.

title: Did Nickelodeon Go Off Air for Several Minutes To Protest Police Brutality?
subtitle: The children's network also published a "Declaration of Kids' Rights."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nickelodeon, the children's network, went off air for eight minutes and 46 seconds to protest police brutality.

title: Is This Photo of an Officer Aiming a Rubber Bullet Gun Near a Child Real?
subtitle: The photographer described the image as "the most impactful picture I have ever taken."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a police officer in riot gear aiming a rubber bullet gun near a little boy sitting on an adult's shoulders.

title: Does This Picture Show George Floyd with a Bible?
subtitle: Floyd was a devout Christian who mentored others.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows George Floyd holding up a Bible.

title: Did Trump Post a Video with Biden Logo on a Coffin?
subtitle: A video posted to U.S. President Donald Trump's Facebook page drew instant criticism.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A video posted to U.S. President Donald Trump's Facebook page showed Joe Biden's campaign logo superimposed on a coffin.

title: Did Twitter Slap a Warning Label on a Trump Tweet for 'Glorifying Violence'?
subtitle: The U.S. president's tweets about May 2020 protests of police in Minneapolis generated heated reactions.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Twitter added a warning label to and hid U.S. President Donald Trump's tweet about the Minneapolis protests against police brutality, saying it violated the platform's rules against "glorifying violence."

title: Are These Petri Dishes Coughed On With and Without a Mask?
subtitle: This visual aid did not involve a person with COVID-19.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows one petri dish that was coughed on by a person not wearing a mask and another petri dish coughed on by the same person wearing a mask.

title: Did Trump Retweet a Video Saying 'The Only Good Democrat is a Dead Democrat'?
subtitle: The original comment was made by a public official in New Mexico.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump retweeted a video in which the speaker stated, "The only good Democrat is a dead Democrat."

title: Does This Photo Show Trump Wearing a Protective Mask?
subtitle: The U.S. president went without a mask for much of his visit to a Ford manufacturing plant in Michigan in late spring 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows U.S. President Donald Trump wearing a protective face mask during a visit to a Ford manufacturing plant in spring 2020.

title: Has President Trump Ever Voted by Mail?
subtitle: As Trump criticized voting by mail, some social media users shined a light on the president's own voting record.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump has voted via mailed absentee ballot in United States elections.

title: Is This 'Muzzles Are for Dogs and Slaves' Protest Sign Real?
subtitle: Muzzles can serve a variety of purposes, but none includes preventing the transmission of infectious diseases through the air.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a protester against pandemic stay-at-home orders holding a sign declaring that "muzzles are for dogs and slaves."

title: Did Trump Call for Obama to Resign After Ebola Doctor Returned to U.S.?
subtitle: "We all lose when we allow irrational fear, fueled in part by prime-time ratings and political expediency, to supersede pragmatic public health preparedness," that doctor later wrote.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: In October 2014, Donald Trump tweeted that U.S. President Barack Obama should resign because a doctor who had treated Ebola patients in Guinea returned to the U.S.

title: Did Trump Say More COVID-19 Testing Makes the US Look Bad?
subtitle: The president has been accused of forgetting the people behind the coronavirus case numbers.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said that increased COVID-19 testing makes the U.S. look bad by increasing coronavirus case numbers.

title: Did Fauci Warn Trump in 2017 That a 'Surprise Outbreak' Was Coming?
subtitle: Dr. Anthony Fauci has led the NIAID for more than three decades, advising five U.S. presidents on global health threats.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: NAIAD director Dr. Anthony Fauci warned in January 2017 that the Trump administration would face a surprise infectious disease outbreak.

title: Does This Restaurant Receipt Show a COVID-19 Surcharge?
subtitle: The COVID-19 pandemic has caused prices for meat and proteins to climb across the board.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An image shows a restaurant receipt displaying a 5% COVID-19 surcharge.

title: Is This 'Social Distancing = Communism' Protest Sign Real?
subtitle: At times it seems as if "communism" has become a general term to describe any undesirable action taken by government.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A sign shows an anti-lockdown protester carrying a sign reading "Social Distancing = Communism."

title: Is This Poplar Fluff Burning in Spain?
subtitle: The "fluff" is actually seeds from poplar trees.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows the fluff of poplar trees burning across a field in Spain.

title: Did 'Live and Let Die' Play as Trump Toured Factory Without COVID-19 Mask?
subtitle: According to the CDC, everyone should wear some sort of protection over their noses and mouths in public settings where it's hard to keep distance between other people.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: During the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic, U.S. President Donald Trump visited a manufacturing plant without wearing a face mask as Guns N' Roses' rendition of "Live and Let Die" played on loudspeakers during his visit.

title: Did Elon Musk and Grimes Say They Named Their Baby 'X Æ A-12'?
subtitle: An experimental pop star and space-exploring billionaire have a baby together. How unusual can the name choice be?
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Elon Musk and Grimes announced on social media that they named their newborn son "X Æ A-12 Musk."

title: Are 'Murder Hornets' Really This Size?
subtitle: A photograph appeared to show four of a kind, queens. Asian giant hornet queens, that is.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows four Asian giant hornets barely fitting on the palm of someone's hand.

title: Does This Photo Show a Grocery Store Shopper in a KKK Hood?
subtitle: Santee, California, has been associated with white supremacist activity for years, earning the city the nickname "Klantee."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a customer shopping at a grocery store during the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic wearing a Ku Klux Klan-like hood over his head.

title: Did Trump Blame Obama for 'Bad' COVID-19 Tests?
subtitle: It wasn't the first time the U.S. president suggested his predecessor was somehow responsible for difficulties his administration faced in responding to the coronavirus pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump implied the Obama administration left behind "bad," "broken," and "obsolete" COVID-19 diagnostic tests.

title: Is Starbucks Opening a Roasting Facility in China?
subtitle: The announcement that Starbucks is expanding its brand in Asia proved meme-worthy.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Starbucks is opening a coffee bean roasting facility in China.

title: Did Trump Tweet That Reporters Should Return 'Noble' Prizes?
subtitle: Journalism may be a noble profession, but reporters aren't awarded "noble prizes."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump posted (and then deleted) tweets calling for the revocation of "Noble Prizes" awarded to "lamestream media" reporters.

title: Was a 'Sacrifice the Weak' Sign Shown at a COVID-19 'ReOpen Tennessee' Rally?
subtitle: A person reportedly was seen holding up such a sign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A picture shows a person holding a "Sacrifice the Weak" sign at a rally urging the state of Tennessee to re-start its economy amid COVID-19 lockdown orders.

title: Is This a Real Message Displayed at a COVID-19 Anti-Lockdown Protest?
subtitle: Demonstrators in many different U.S. cities protested that COVID-19 social-distancing restrictions were unnecessary or had continued for too long.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a "Your Health Is Not More Important Than My Liberties!" message displayed on an automobile window at a protest calling for the loosening of COVID-19 social-distancing restrictions.

title: Did Trump Suggest Injecting Disinfectants as COVID-19 Treatment?
subtitle: The U.S. president's comments prompted doctors and the makers of household disinfectants to issue statements urging people not to ingest or inject cleaning products.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump suggested during a White House briefing that injecting disinfectants could treat COVID-19.

title: Does 'Quarantine' Originate from the Word 'Forty' (Days) in Italian?
subtitle: A "quarantine" separates and restricts the movement of people who were exposed to a contagious disease to see if they become sick.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The word "quarantine" stems from the Italian word for "forty," representing the number of days persons potentially exposed to communicable diseases had to remain in isolation.

title: Is This a Flyer for an 'End the Lockdown Rally'?
subtitle: Even though a Staten Island rally didn't come to fruition, similar anti-social distancing protests took place across the U.S.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a flyer posted for an "End the Lockdown Rally" in Staten Island.

title: Did Ohio Man Who Called COVID-19 a 'Political Ploy' Die from the Disease?
subtitle: John W. McDaniel of Ohio passed away at the age of 60 in April 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An Ohio man died from complications related to the COVID-19 coronavirus disease weeks after he downplayed the virus on social media.

title: Did Trump Criticize Governors for Backing off Ebola Quarantines in 2014?
subtitle: A very old tweet got new life during the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted in 2014 that governors were making a mistake by backing off Ebola quarantines.

title: Does This Photo Show an Anti-Semitic Sign at a COVID-19 Lockdown Protest?
subtitle: The protest movement against coronavirus restrictions has highlighted a variety of messages, some of them quite unsavory.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows protesters displaying an anti-Semitic sign during a COVID-19 lockdown protest.

title: Did BBB Warn Against Sharing High School Senior Photos?
subtitle: Facebook users started a posting trend to show solidarity with 2020's graduating seniors who are finishing high school at home due to the coronavirus pandemic.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: The Better Business Bureau advised Facebook users to reconsider posting high school senior photos in spring 2020 to help protect their online privacy.

title: Is WWE's Vince McMahon Advising Trump on the Economy?
subtitle: The White House published a list of business leaders said to advise the president on reopening the U.S. economy. Apparently, one name stood out.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tapped World Wrestling Entertainment CEO Vince McMahon as an adviser on reopening the U.S. economy.

title: Did These Pencils Accidentally Promote Doing Drugs?
subtitle: Some mistakes are harder to erase.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Pencils bearing an anti-drug slogan had to be recalled because sharpening them subverted their message.

title: Is This 'Shaun of the Dead' Meme Mocking Real Ohio Protesters?
subtitle: A viral photograph from a protest against stay-at-home orders during the COVID-19 pandemic was likened to the zombie movie "Shaun of the Dead."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of people outside of the Ohio Statehouse protesting shelter-in-place laws put in place during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did Trump Praise China for Its 'Transparency' on COVID-19?
subtitle: The president's opinion of China's handling of the coronavirus pandemic has changed over time.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump praised China for its "transparency" in handling the coronavirus outbreak, then later criticized the World Health Organization for doing the same.

title: Will Trump's Name Appear on COVID-19 Stimulus Checks?
subtitle: While the unprecedented move could potentially delay these payments, U.S. Treasury officials insist the checks "are scheduled to go out on time and exactly as planned."
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump's name will appear on COVID-19 stimulus checks.

title: Did Obama Urge US Pandemic Preparedness in 2014?
subtitle: "There may and likely will come a time in which we have an airborne disease that is deadly," said the former president.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video clip shows former President Barack Obama stressing the need for U.S. pandemic preparedness in 2014.

title: Did CBS News Use Footage from Italy for New York COVID-19 Report?
subtitle: The news outlet acknowledged the error, but that wasn't the end of the story.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A CBS News program used a brief clip from an Italian hospital in a segment about the coronavirus crisis in New York City.

title: Was National Stockpile Website Edited After Jared Kushner's Comments?
subtitle: On April 2, 2020, Jared Kushner said of the federal stockpile: "It's supposed to be our stockpile. It's not supposed to be states' stockpiles that they then use."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Text on a government website for the Strategic National Stockpile was altered after Jared Kushner's remarks during an April 2020 press conference.

title: Did Time Magazine Warn About Global Warming, Pandemic Years Ago?
subtitle: Who could have seen this coming? Just about anyone who can read.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Time magazine covers from 2006 and 2017 highlighted articles warning about global warming and a pandemic.

title: Is This a Real Letter from Trump to US Sen. Chuck Schumer?
subtitle: Some questioned whether an acrimonious letter from U.S. President Donald Trump to the senator from coronavirus-stricken New York was real.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Trump wrote Sen. Chuck Schumer, D-New York, a letter blaming the state's medical-supply shortage amid an ongoing pandemic on impeachment proceedings against Trump.

title: Did Experts and Officials Warn in 2018 US Couldn't Respond Effectively to a Pandemic?
subtitle: Such individuals have made repeated warnings about U.S. readiness in the event of a pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Experts and officials warned in 2018 that the U.S. government would be unable to respond effectively to a pandemic.

title: Did Trump Golf, Hold Rallies After Learning About COVID-19 Threat?
subtitle: After Sen. Mitch McConnell suggested the government's response to the initial coronavirus outbreak was in part distracted by the president's impeachment, rebuttal memes started flying.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump golfed several times and held a number of rallies after learning about the threat of the coronavirus.

title: Did the Trump Administration Send 18 Tons of PPE to China in Early 2020?
subtitle: Critics have questioned the wisdom of exporting to China medical supplies that would soon be vitally needed in the U.S.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The U.S. facilitated the sending of nearly 17.8 tons of donated medical supplies to China to combat the spread of the novel coronavirus in early 2020.

title: Do Photos Show Las Vegas Homeless Sleeping in 'Social Distanced' Parking Lot?
subtitle: "Las Vegas is now packing people into concrete grids out of sight," one critic proclaimed.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a homeless shelter with painted social-distancing boxes in a Las Vegas parking lot.

title: Did Empire State Building Display 'Siren' Lights During COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: A strange sight for strange times.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Empire State Building displayed a red and white "siren" light during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did Cities Close Schools, Businesses During the 1918 Pandemic?
subtitle: The year 2020 was not the first time public places were ordered closed to prevent the spread of a disease.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A newspaper clipping from 1918 documents a "public notice" from the city of Kelowna, British Columbia, announcing that schools, movie theaters, and other public places would be closed to prevent the spread of "Spanish Influenza."

title: Does 'Triscuit' Mean 'Electric Biscuit'?
subtitle: The cracker world would never be the same after one Twitter user revealed the origin story of this oddly named snack.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Triscuit crackers are so named because they are biscuits "baked by electricity."

title: Did Amazon Solicit Donations to Help Pay Worker Sick Leave?
subtitle: After being called out for its approach to supporting seasonal and contract workers during times of crisis, the retail giant made some edits.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Amazon solicited donations from the public to pay sick leave to contractors and seasonal workers during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did DOJ Propose Rollback of Defendants' Rights During Pandemic?
subtitle: Any changes affecting constitutional guarantees afforded federal criminal defendants in the U.S. would ultimately be up to Congress.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The U.S. Department of Justice under Trump has proposed granting federal judges broad authority to pause court proceedings during a national emergency, effectively allowing defendants to be detained indefinitely until the emergency is deemed over.

title: Are Most Cruise Ships Registered Under Foreign Flags?
subtitle: The economic strain of the COVID-19 pandemic prompted some to point fingers at companies perceived to be skirting the rules.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Nearly all ships operated by U.S.-headquartered cruise lines are registered in foreign countries.

title: Did Video Show Italian Army Trucks Transporting Coffins Amid COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: A stark illustration of the tragic impact coronavirus had on parts of Italy in 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Images shared in March 2020 showed a convoy of military trucks transporting bodies away from an over-subscribed crematorium in Bergamo, Italy.

title: Was COVID-19 Discovered in the US and South Korea on the Same Day?
subtitle: These two countries took different approaches in the early days of the pandemic and saw vastly different results.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The first cases of COVID-19 were reported in the United States and South Korea on the same day.

title: Did Coronavirus Vaccine Story Run Same Day as Reports of Kobe's Death?
subtitle: News of the NBA legend's death overshadowed the emerging COVID-19 pandemic in the U.S. in late January 2020.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: USA Today published a front-page article about the development of a COVID-19 vaccine the same day Kobe Bryant's death was reported.

title: Was 'Coronavirus' Replaced with 'Chinese Virus' in Trump's Notes?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump has faced criticism for his insistence in referring to COVID-19 as the "Chinese virus."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A photograph posted on social media in March 2020 shows an authentic image of U.S. President Donald Trump's speech notes with the word "Corona" scratched out and replaced in handwriting by "Chinese."

title: Did Italy Confirm Almost 200 Coronavirus Deaths in 24 Hours?
subtitle: As of early March 2020, Italy had seen the worst COVID-19 outbreak outside Asia.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Almost 200 people in Italy died from the coronavirus in a 24-hour period between March 11 and 12, 2020.

title: Was a Rare White Giraffe Killed by Poachers in Kenya?
subtitle: The giraffe and her calf, which both had a condition known as leucism, went missing over four months ago.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Kenya's only female white giraffe and her calf were killed by poachers.

title: Is This a Photo of an American Revolutionary War Vet?
subtitle: Conrad Heyer played a role in the founding of the United States and in the history of early photography.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A black-and-white photograph depicts a real veteran of the American Revolutionary War.

title: Is the Quokka a Real Animal?
subtitle: Understandably, some readers found this critter's natural smile too good to be true.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a real animal with an apparent resting smile called a quokka.

title: Did Councilwoman Candi CdeBaca Tweet '#Solidarity' for This Coronavirus Comment?
subtitle: A viral tweet raised eyebrows amid an outbreak of new coronavirus in early 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Denver councilwoman Candi CdeBaca tweeted "#solidarity" in response to a post suggesting that, if infected with new coronavirus, a person would attend as many Trump rallies as possible.

title: A Zebra with Dots Instead of Stripes?
subtitle: We weren't expecting that.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a zebra that was born with dots instead of stripes.

title: Did Trump Administration Fire the US Pandemic Response Team?
subtitle: As a new coronavirus spread in 2020, so did concerns about the United States' preparedness for a potential pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Trump administration fired the U.S. pandemic response team in 2018 to cut costs.

title: Did Clint Eastwood Express Support for Mike Bloomberg in 2020?
subtitle: The Hollywood icon supported the election of Donald Trump in 2016.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2020, Clint Eastwood expressed support for the election of Mike Bloomberg as president.

title: Did Trump Propose Cuts to Federal Pay Raises, Citing 'Serious Economic Conditions'?
subtitle: A day after the announcement, the president tweeted, "BEST USA ECONOMY IN HISTORY!"
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump cited "serious economic conditions" while proposing a cut to federal pay raises.

title: Is This Photo of Trump, Bloomberg, Clinton, and Giuliani Real?
subtitle: Some viewers had trouble picturing these politicians golfing together.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows U.S. President Donald Trump, former Mayor Mike Bloomberg, former President Bill Clinton, and former Mayor Rudy Giuliani together on a golf course.

title: Did Obama's Last 3 Years See More Jobs Created Than Trump's First 3?
subtitle: Left-leaning critics of U.S. President Donald Trump rejected his claims to overseeing unprecedented economic growth in early 2020. Who was right?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: During the final three years of Barack Obama's presidency, the number of jobs added was 1.5 million greater than the number added during President Donald Trump's first three years in office.

title: Did a U.S. Congressman Brutally Beat a Senator in the 19th Century?
subtitle: After U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi ripped up President Donald Trump's State of the Union speech, one journalist called it the "most classless act ever conducted in Congress." Others disagreed.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 1856 U.S. House Rep. Preston Brooks brutally attacked Sen. Charles Sumner with a cane in the U.S. Senate chamber.

title: Did Rush Limbaugh Refer to 12-Year-Old Chelsea Clinton as a Dog?
subtitle: An old controversy was renewed in 2020 after the radio host was awarded the Medal of Freedom by U.S. President Donald Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Radio host Rush Limbaugh once referred to 12-year-old Chelsea Clinton as a dog.

title: Does Border Wall Construction Threaten Native American Burial Sites?
subtitle: According to Arizona Rep. Raul Grijalva, explosions occurred on Monument Hill where a Tohono O'odham Nation burial site resides.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Controlled blasting was used near Native American burial sites during the the construction of a U.S.-Mexico border wall in Arizona's Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument.

title: Was Pete Buttigieg's Father a Marxist Who Spoke Fondly of 'Communist Manifesto'?
subtitle: As the 2020 Democratic presidential primaries began to heat up, so did the scrutiny on candidates and their connections.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Joseph Buttigieg was a "Marxist professor" who "lauded" and "spoke fondly" of "The Communist Manifesto" written by Friedrich Engels and Karl Marx.

title: Did Trolls Try to Clog Phone Lines After Iowa Caucuses?
subtitle: A clogged phone line was just one of many problems following the Iowa caucuses in February 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Internet trolls attempted to disrupt the Iowa caucuses by flooding the phone lines where caucus managers called in results.

title: Did Rush Limbaugh Accuse Michael J. Fox of Exaggerating His Parkinson's Symptoms?
subtitle: A 2006 controversy resurfaced in 2020 after the conservative radio host was diagnosed with lung cancer.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Radio host Rush Limbaugh once claimed that actor Michael J. Fox was "exaggerating" his Parkinson's disease symptoms in a political ad.

title: Does a Photo Show a Man Fighting IS in a Kobe Jersey?
subtitle: An old photograph received new attention in the wake of the NBA icon's death in January 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man fighting against the Islamic State with a rocket launcher while wearing a Kobe Bryant jersey.

title: Is China Building a Hospital in 10 Days to Treat Coronavirus Patients?
subtitle: Millions of people are quarantined in China to prevent the spread of the virus.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Chinese government is building a hospital in 10 days to deal with the new coronavirus.

title: Did Trump Congratulate the Wrong State for the Chiefs' Super Bowl Win?
subtitle: The Chiefs' victory in Super Bowl LIV was a great day for Kansas City, wherever it may be.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump congratulated the wrong state for the Chiefs' 2020 Super Bowl win.

title: Does New York Require a Permit to Stargaze in State Parks?
subtitle: A few websites reported, with a note of outrage, that New York state was charging an annual fee to take in the night sky at six Long Island public parks.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of January 2020, New York state requires members of the public to obtain a stargazing permit for use in certain public parks.

title: Did Playgirl Run a 'Sleep with Donald Trump' Contest in 1990?
subtitle: Always read the fine print.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Playgirl magazine ran a "Sleep with Donald Trump" contest promotion in 1990.

title: Did a 2012 Tweet Predict Kobe's Death?
subtitle: An eerily prescient tweet gained prominence after the tragic demise of basketball legend Kobe Bryant in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In November 2012, a Twitter user posted a tweet that stated "Kobe is going to end up dying in a helicopter crash."

title: Is This Kobe Bryant Playing 'Moonlight Sonata'?
subtitle: Kobe Bryant may have been best known for his basketball skills, but he was a man of many other talents.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Kobe Bryant playing Beethoven's "Moonlight Sonata."

title: Is This a Photo of 'Tornadoes' Forming as Lava Hits Water?
subtitle: This is what (sometimes) happens when lava meets the ocean.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows lava pouring into an ocean and seven resulting vortices, or what some called "tornadoes."

title: Did Sea Foam Fill Streets in Spain?
subtitle: NOAA explained that sea foam forms "when dissolved organic matter in the ocean is churned up."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a street in Spain filled with sea foam after a large storm.

title: Did Confederate Flags Fly at a Gun-Rights Rally in Virginia?
subtitle: One right-wing observer called U.S. Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez a liar for claiming that protesters in Richmond carried Confederate flags in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Confederate flags appeared at a gun-rights rally in Richmond, Virginia, on Jan. 20, 2020.

title: Did Virginia Declare a State of Emergency Ahead of Pro-Gun Rallies?
subtitle: An executive order signed by the governor mentioned the need to prevent violence akin to what happened in Charlottesville 2017.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The state of Virginia declared a state of emergency ahead of pro-gun rallies in Richmond, Virginia.

title: Did a Missouri Bill Propose Imprisoning Librarians?
subtitle: House Bill 2044, which was aimed at events such as "Drag Queen Story Time" in public libraries, caused controversy upon its introduction in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: HB 2044, a bill before the Missouri state House of Representatives, could lead to the imprisonment of librarians for failing to comply with its provisions.

title: Did the FDA Approve a Cocaine Nasal Spray?
subtitle: The federal regulator did give its approval for a new local anesthetic with the brand name Numbrino in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2020, the Food and Drug Administration approved a nasal spray containing cocaine.

title: Is Gwyneth Paltrow Selling a Candle That 'Smells Like My Vagina'?
subtitle: Paltrow's lifestyle brand Goop has a track record of selling eccentric items.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Gwyneth Paltrow is selling a candle that "smells like my vagina."

title: Did President Trump Tweet 'How Are Your 409Ks Doing'?
subtitle: What appeared to be a typo was quickly deleted but archived.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted "HOW ARE YOUR 409K'S DOING?"

title: Is This Video of a Tarantula Swimming Real?
subtitle: Swimming spiders are the stuff of nightmares ... and reality?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a tarantula swimming.

title: Were 10,000 Camels Scheduled to Be Killed in Australia Amid Water Shortages?
subtitle: Multiple websites and social media memes lamented a population-control strategy announced by authorities in South Australia amid drought and extreme heat in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2020, officials in the state of South Australia announced a plan to cull around 10,000 feral camels in response to concerns over public safety and environmental resources.

title: Is This a Real Calvin and Hobbes Cartoon?
subtitle: Comic strips are not infrequently altered to replace their original dialogue with political messages.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A "Calvin and Hobbes" strip questioning how "soldiers killing each other solve's the worlds problems" is real.

title: Did President Obama Order More Than 500 Drone Strikes?
subtitle: The drone program has ratcheted up with each successive administration.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Barack Obama authorized more than 500 drone strikes.

title: Does This Photo Show Wedding Rings Taken from Holocaust Victims?
subtitle: “Every wedding ring here represents a home broken and a human murdered by the Germans."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph documents a cache of wedding rings removed from Holocaust victims.

title: Did a Michigan County Threaten to Demolish Amish Homes Unless They Were Upgraded?
subtitle: Relatively obscure websites plagiarized the ACLU's accurate summary of an ongoing court battle in late 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2019, Lenawee County threatened to demolish the homes of several Amish families unless the families brought them into compliance with health codes.

title: Did Clinton Launch Airstrike on Iraq Amid Impeachment Proceedings?
subtitle: Some drew comparisons to President Donald Trump's ordered airstrike that killed an Iranian general in early 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Bill Clinton launched an airstrike on Iraq amid impeachment proceedings against him in 1998.

title: Is Jason Garrett Out as Dallas Cowboys' Coach?
subtitle: Garrett's position definitely appeared to be in question in December 2019.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Jason Garrett is out as Dallas Cowboys' coach.

title: Is This a 3-Horned Ankole Cow in Uganda?
subtitle: Ankole cattle are known for their over-sized horns.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a three-horned ankole cow in Uganda.

title: Did Michael Bloomberg's Presidential Campaign Use Prison Labor?
subtitle: The former New York mayor landed in hot water over a vendor's reported use of prison workers to place calls to would-be voters.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2019, the presidential campaign of Michael Bloomberg worked with a vendor that used prison labor on the campaign's behalf.

title: Does a Photo Show a Menorah Displayed in Defiance of Nazism?
subtitle: During the festival of Hanukkah in December 2019, social media users shared a powerful image from 1930s Germany.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A widely shared image is an authentic photograph that shows a Hanukkah menorah displayed in the home of a Jewish family in Nazi Germany in 1932.

title: Did Lindsey Graham Really Say This in 1998 About Presidential Impeachment?
subtitle: The U.S. senator from South Carolina is not exactly known for the consistency of his positions.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Lindsey Graham once said President Richard Nixon made himself subject to impeachment the day he failed to answer a congressional subpoena.

title: Did Some 'Penis Fish' Wash Ashore on a California Beach?
subtitle: Sometimes reality is way, way hard to believe.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Photographs show so-called "penis fish" washed ashore on a California beach.

title: Is This Nancy Reagan With Mr. T Dressed As Santa Claus?
subtitle: Pity the fools who are just learning about this friendship.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows then-first lady Nancy Reagan with Mr. T dressed up as Santa Claus.

title: Does a Netflix Special Feature a 'Gay Jesus'?
subtitle: More than a million people have signed a petition asking Netflix to remove "The First Temptation of Christ."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Netflix special entitled "The First Temptation of Christ" implied that Jesus was homosexual.

title: Did UK Politician Diane Abbott Wear Mismatched Shoes in Elex Day Photos?
subtitle: The prominent Labour Party MP appeared to have an unusual wardrobe malfunction in December 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Diane Abbott was photographed wearing mismatched shoes on Dec. 12, 2019.

title: Does Rudy Giuliani's Son Work in the White House?
subtitle: Allegations of nepotism flew during impeachment hearings against U.S. President Donald Trump.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The son of U.S. President Donald Trump's personal attorney, Rudy Giuliani, works in the White House.

title: Was the Statue of Liberty Originally a Different Color?
subtitle: Copper-oxidation reactions can produce a natural patina on surfaces that significantly changes their colors.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The Statue of Liberty was made with copper and changed color via oxidation after it was constructed.

title: Does This Photo Show a Boy Forced to Sleep on the Floor of an English Hospital?
subtitle: Two waves of social media posts cast doubt in the minds of some over the authenticity of a story that proved a major moment in the 2019 U.K. general election.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A photograph published in December 2019 showed a boy forced to sleep on a hospital floor in Leeds, England, due to overcrowding.

title: Is the Trump Admin Ending Food Assistance for Nearly 700,000 People?
subtitle: A rule change that hardens work requirements for those receiving federal food assistance is expected to go into effect in 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Trump administration in the U.S. is ending food assistance for nearly 700,000 people.

title: Is This a Photo of Vladimir Putin with Fiona Hill?
subtitle: As a leading expert on Russia, Hill attended the Valdai Discussion Club several times.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Russian President Vladimir Putin with U.S. Foreign Affairs Specialist Fiona Hill.

title: Did the FBI Warn That Smart TVs Might Spy on You?
subtitle: Warnings to consumers about various products often accompany the holiday shopping season.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The FBI warned that smart TVs can "spy" on their owners.

title: Was Queen Elizabeth II a Mechanic During World War II?
subtitle: Princess Elizabeth was the first female member of the Royal Family to join the Armed Services as a full-time active member.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows England's Queen Elizabeth II working as a mechanic during World War II.

title: Was This Dog Found 'Mummified' Inside the Trunk of a Tree?
subtitle: The story of "Stuckie" frequently draws incredulous comments.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a dog that was "mummified" inside the trunk of a tree.

title: Did a Starbucks Employee Add the Word 'Pig' to a Police Officer's Order?
subtitle: A Starbucks in Glenpool, Oklahoma, become the center of controversy in late 2019.

title: Did Joe Biden Mention His 'Hairy Legs' In Public Remarks?
