title: Is This Bloomberg with Jeffrey Epstein Associate Ghislaine Maxwell?
subtitle: The British socialite has been pictured with countless public figures over the years.

statement: A photograph shows former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg with Ghislaine Maxwell, a close associate of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Did A.C. Moore Announce It's Closing All of Its Stores?

author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In November 2019, A.C. Moore announced it was going out of business and would be closing its stores.

title: Do Sea Otters Rape Baby Seals?
subtitle: “This woman told me otters rape baby seals,” comedian Michelle Wolfe said in a recent standup set.

statement: Otters sometimes rape baby seals.

title: Did Trump Sign a Law Making Animal Cruelty a Federal Crime?

statement: U.S. actor Tom Hanks is related to "Mister Rogers' Neighborhood" host Fred Rogers.

title: Did Police Warn That Facebook Quizzes Could Lead to Identity Theft?
subtitle: A warning crops up periodically to avoid taking quizzes posted to Facebook.
author: Bethania Palma

statement: Amazon paid zero dollars in federal income tax in 2018.

title: Did a Loud Fart Give a Suspect's Location Away to Police?
subtitle: Sometimes the truth is smellier than fiction.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A picture shows a genuine news story about a loud fart giving a criminal suspect's location away to police.

title: Did US Rep. Steve King Falsely Identify the Ukraine Whistleblower?
subtitle: A picture posted to the Iowa Republican's Twitter timeline drew backlash.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Rep. Steve King falsely identified the Ukraine whistleblower.

title: Was the First Known Use of 'OMG' Written in a Letter to Churchill?
subtitle: Many may assume the term "OMG" originated with teens and smart phones.

title: Did Some Phone Cameras Inadvertently Open While Users Scrolled Facebook App?

author: Dan Evon
statement: User videos taken in November 2019 showed Facebook's mobile application inadvertently opening the phone's camera in the background.

title: Is This 'Unicorn Puppy' Real?

statement: A photograph shows a "unicorn puppy" with a tail growing from his forehead.

title: Did Donald Trump 'Save' the NYC Vets Day Parade in 1995?
subtitle: Trump reportedly donated $200,000 and helped raise another $500,000 for the "Nation's Parade."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump "saved" the Veterans Day parade in New York City in 1995.

title: Is This Photo of a Couple Wearing 'Blacks for Trump' Shirts Real?

statement: A photograph shows a white couple wearing "Blacks for Trump" T-shirts.

title: Was Joe Biden's Niece Sentenced to Probation for $110,000 in Credit Card Theft?
subtitle: A dredging-up of old information about the non-political relative of a prominent politician.

title: Did Rapper T.I. Say He Takes His Daughter to a Doc to Check Her Virginity?

title: Is This Cellphone Prediction from 1953 Real?

title: Did This Golf Robot Hit a Hole-in-One?
subtitle: With advancements in robotics and computer generated images, it can be difficult to tell what's real and what's not.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a golfing robot hitting a hole-in-one.

title: Was the Keystone Pipeline Shut Down After Leaking Oil?

author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Keystone Pipeline in North Dakota was shut down after it leaked oil.

title: Was U.S. President Andrew Johnson Impeached in 3 Days?
subtitle: In 1868, Andrew Johnson became the first president in United States history to be impeached.

title: Did WaPo Headline Call IS Leader al-Baghdadi an 'Austere Religious Scholar'?

title: Did President Trump Get Booed at the 2019 World Series?
subtitle: The U.S. president appeared somewhat surprised by the crowd's reaction.

statement: U.S. President Donald Trump was booed by the crowd at the World Series in October 2019.

title: Did Trump Say to 'Stop Congratulating Obama for Killing Bin Laden'?

title: Did Dolly Parton Write 'Jolene' and 'I Will Always Love You' in One Day?

title: Did Trump Send Letter to Turkish Prez Erdogan Saying 'Don't Be a Fool'?
subtitle: Some questioned whether the unconventional letter was authentic.

statement: U.S. President Trump sent Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan a letter urging him, "Don't be a fool!"

title: Did ABC Mistakenly Label a Video from a US Gun Range as Syrian War Footage?
subtitle: A video that aired during ABC News' coverage of Turkey's attack on Kurds in northern Syria drew widespread attention.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: ABC News mistakenly aired a video from a Kentucky gun range during its coverage of Turkey's attack on northern Syria in October 2019.

title: Did Congressman Tweet Pix of Russian Warship While Wishing US Navy Happy Birthday?

author: Bethania Palma

title: Did a Convicted Sex Offender Read to Children at a Houston Public Library?

title: Did U.S. Sen. Lindsey Graham Once Say a Crime Isn't Required for Impeachment?
subtitle: U.S. Sen. Lindsey Graham also argued a "high crime" was simply an important person hurting someone of low means.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Sen. Lindsey Graham argued in 1999 that a crime wasn't necessary for presidential impeachment.

title: Did a Fox News Guest Disparage Teen Climate Activist Greta Thunberg?
subtitle: The cable network issued an apology for a statement made on one of its programs.

title: Is Kik Messenger App Shutting Down?

author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Livingston, the CEO of Kik Interactive, announced in September 2019 that the Kik messaging app would be shutting down.

title: Does America Have More Governors Who Have Worn Blackface Than Black Governors?
subtitle: The question gets at the heart of whether an African American currently leads the executive branch of any state in the United States.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The U.S. has more governors who have worn blackface than actual black governors.

title: Is This a Photo of 5 People Atop a Skyscraper Spire?
subtitle: Regardless of the authenticity of this picture, we're not sure it lives up to being the "mother of all selfies."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows five people atop a skyscraper spire.

title: Does This Video Show US Air Traffic on Sept. 11, 2001?
subtitle: Some 4,000 planes were grounded in the span of a few hours.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An animation video shows air traffic over the United States on Sept. 11, 2001, as thousands of flights were grounded after a terrorist attack on the country.

title: Did a Man Catch a Cellphone Mid-Air on a Roller Coaster?
subtitle: This wouldn't be the first time someone caught a dropped item on a roller coaster.

title: Did Blood Gather in Joe Biden's Eye During a CNN Town Hall Debate?

author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Blood spots were visible in the left eye of Joe Biden, a 2020 U.S. Democratic presidential candidate, during a CNN debate in September 2019.

title: Did Trump Display an Altered Hurricane Dorian Map Showing Alabama in Its Path?

author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump displayed an altered graphic purporting to show Hurricane Dorian potentially hitting Alabama.

title: Did CNN Mislabel Alabama as Mississippi on Hurricane Dorian Weather Map?
subtitle: The state of Alabama received some strange news coverage during Hurricane Dorian in the summer of 2019.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN mislabeled the state of Alabama as Mississippi on a weather map of Hurricane Dorian.

title: Could Women Not Do These 9 Things in 1971?
subtitle: A viral list recounts some of the bumps on the road to gender equality.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A viral piece of text accurately lists nine things women couldn't do in 1971.

title: Did the 'Father of Radio' Say Man Would Never Reach the Moon?
subtitle: Persons notable for achievements in one field of science aren't necessarily reliable prognosticators about other scientific fields.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Lee de Forest, the "father of radio," proclaimed that a man-made moon voyage will never occur.

title: Does Search Engine Ecosia Use Profits to Plant Trees?

title: Has the Macaw Species from 'Rio' Movies Been Declared Extinct in the Wild?
subtitle: Saving the species from extinction has been a central focus of the movies' storyline.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The macaw species from the “Rio” movies has been declared extinct in the wild.

title: Are Pins Placed in the Collars of Chinese Officers to Correct Posture?
subtitle: It's definitely difficult to slouch when a needle is poking you in the neck.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a pin in the collar of a Chinese officer's uniform, a training method to correct posture.

title: Did Rick Perry Fall For A Years-Old Social Media Privacy Hoax?

title: Is This a Real Ad for a 'Big Dick' Machine Gun for Kids?

title: Did the FEC Chair Ask Trump for Evidence of Voter Fraud, Writing 'Lay Your Cards on the Table'?

title: Is This a Photo of a Man Feeding a Polar Bear?

author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man hand-feeding a polar bear in Russia.

title: Does Amazon Rent Out College Textbooks?

title: Can Algae Poison a Dog?

title: Did 'Fox and Friends' Call Fred Rogers an 'Evil, Evil Man'?

title: Did Trump Pose With a 'Thumbs-Up' Next to a Baby Orphaned in the El Paso Massacre?
subtitle: The infant's parents died shielding the baby from the gunman's bullets.

subtitle: Covington Catholic's students have a history of donning black body paint during their “black out” basketball games.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A photograph shows a Covington Catholic High School basketball game with students wearing blackface and/or black body paint in the stands.

title: Did President Trump Tout San Antonio as a City Made Safe by a Border Wall?
subtitle: President Donald Trump seemingly boasted to reporters about how well San Antonio's non-existent border wall﻿ is working.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump cited the city of San Antonio, Texas, as an example of a city made much safer by the construction of a wall.

title: Were Three Cats in Wyoming Diagnosed with Bubonic Plague?
subtitle: Officials issued an advisory to residents after a spate of cases within a six-month period.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Three cats in Wyoming were diagnosed with the bubonic plague.

title: Does the Texas DPS Have Armed Patrol Boats on the Rio Grande?
subtitle: Some social media users were surprised to learn the lengths to which Texas officials have gone to address crime along the mighty river.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Texas Dept. of Public Safety boat equipped with machine guns on the Rio Grande.

title: Did Clifford Walker Say at a 1924 KKK Rally That He Would Build a 'Wall of Steel' Against Immigrants?
subtitle: A presidential biographer drew a comparison to then-Georgia Gov. Walker's comments and steel border wall construction desired by President Trump.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Georgia Gov. Clifford Walker said at a 1924 Ku Klux Klan meeting that  he'd "build a wall of steel" against immigrants.

title: Is DC Comics Publishing a Series Depicting Jesus Christ?
subtitle: Conservative media outlets began reporting on "Second Coming" months after its release was first announced.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: DC Comics is publishing a series depicting Jesus Christ living with a superhero.

title: Did Visitors to Joshua Tree National Park Cut Down Trees During the Government Shutdown?
subtitle: The iconic wilderness area fell victim to staff shortages caused by the budget standoff in Washington.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Some visitors to Joshua Tree National Park cut down trees and perpetrated other acts of vandalism in January 2019 while staff, whose numbers were diminished due to the federal government shutdown, attempted to monitor visitor behavior.

title: Is a Newly Introduced Congressional Marijuana Bill Actually Numbered H.R. 420?
subtitle: "The bill number may be a bit tongue-in-cheek,” U.S. Rep. Earl Blumenauer told a local newspaper, but “the issue is very serious."
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A marijuana bill introduced into the U.S. House of Representatives during the 116th Congress is numbered H.R. 420 - a reference to marijuana culture.

title: Did This Video Show Muslims Ripping Up an American Flag on the Streets of New York?
subtitle: The flag-ripping incident was captured on video, but as always there was more to the story than met the eye.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of Muslims ripping up an American flag on a New York City street.

title: Did Sharifa Alkhateeb Talk About Using Public Schools to Convert America to Islam?
subtitle: "Our final objective is to create our own Islamic systems."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Sharifa Alkhateeb speaking about converting America to Islam.

title: Does New York City Allow Residents to Have 'Gender-Neutral' Birth Certificates?
subtitle: New York City joins California, Oregon, Washington state, and New Jersey in providing residents a third option.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: New Yorkers can select a gender-neutral option on their birth certificates.

title: Were High-Income Earners in U.S. Taxed at a 70% Rate in 1980?
subtitle: The question arose in light of proposal by freshman U.S. Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez to tax such earners at a 70% rate.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The marginal tax rate for high-earning individuals or families in 1980 was 70%.

title: Did President Trump Say U.S. Generals Were 'Better Looking Than Tom Cruise, and Stronger'?
subtitle: The 45th president's first public cabinet meeting of 2019 gave rise to a widely shared Facebook meme.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: During a cabinet meeting, President Donald Trump recalled a previous meeting with U.S. military leaders, remarking that they were "better looking than Tom Cruise, and stronger."

title: Did This Frozen Grape Instantaneously Turn Water Into Ice?
subtitle: Supercooled water, which remains liquid below its freezing point, can be tricky to create but is useful for party tricks.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A video shows a frozen grape delicately submerged in a wine glass of water, which then instantly crystallized into a blob of ice around the grape.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Giant Amethyst Geode?
subtitle: Uruguay is known for producing some of the world's most impressive such formations.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A photograph shows a massive amethyst geode from Uruguay.

title: Is This a Photograph of a 'Mummified' Dinosaur?
subtitle: 'Mummified' fossils are those whose soft tissues escaped the normal process of decomposition before undergoing petrification.
author: David Emery
statement: Photographs show a "mummified" dinosaur fossil discovered in Alberta, Canada.

title: Are All These Chemicals Found in a Banana?
subtitle: An “ingredients label” for a banana was created by a high school chemistry teacher as part of a lesson on chemophobia.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A list of chemicals, written as if they were ingredients on a food label, accurately depicts the chemical composition of a banana.

title: Did Putin Just Send Two Supersonic Nuclear Bombers to Venezuela?
subtitle: A December 2018 incident was not the first time Russian Tu-160s had been spotted in Venezuela.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Russian president Vladimir Putin sent two supersonic nuclear bombers to Venezuela in December 2018.

title: Did a GoFundMe Campaign to Fund a Border Wall Raise Millions of Dollars Within a Few Days?
subtitle: In the midst of a budget standoff between Congressional Democrats and the White House, some Americans sought to take matters into their own hands.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A GoFundMe campaign raised millions of dollars for the construction of a border wall within a few days of its launch in December 2018.

title: Are Over 100 Whales Trapped in Underwater 'Jails'?
subtitle: Animal welfare activists and experts are deeply concerned about 90 belugas and 11 orcas that were kept in pens off the Russian coast.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: More than 100 whales are trapped in an underwater 'jail.'

title: Did David 'Avocado' Wolfe Post a Meme About Solar Panels Draining Light from the Sun?
subtitle: “Solar panels are not renewable, the light they absorb is lost forever,” he wrote, adding “like and share!”
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: David “Avocado” Wolfe once posted a meme describing solar power as non-renewable because the light solar panels absorb is lost forever.

title: Does a Texas Law Require Government Contractors to Swear They Won't Boycott Israel?
subtitle: A December 2018 lawsuit highlighted the case of an elementary school pathologist in Austin.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A 2017 law passed in Texas requires would-be government contractors to sign an oath promising they will not boycott Israel.

title: Did a Prada Store Remove Products Resembling 'Blackface Imagery'?
subtitle: A civil rights attorney who photographed the display called the company "completely tone deaf."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Prada removed a display from their store in the Soho neighborhood of New York City after a complaint regarding monkey-like figurines spread widely online.

title: Is Trump's Face Hidden in These Baboon Feces?
subtitle: "The editors have become aware of unusual aspects to the 'Extract fecal DNA' illustration in figure 1."
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A scientific paper included a diagram with a representation of baboon feces containing President Trump's face.

title: Did a Brain-Eating Amoeba Kill a Woman Who Rinsed Her Sinuses with Tap Water?
subtitle: Balamuthia mandrillaris infections are extremely rare and largely preventable, but the few cases that do occur are usually fatal.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A woman who rinsed her nasal passages using a neti pot filled with tap water contracted a fatal “brain-eating” amoeba infection.

title: Did Jon Voight Urge Americans to 'Fight for Donald Trump'?
subtitle: The Academy Award-winning actor is a prominent Hollywood conservative and vocal supporter of the 45th president.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Jon Voight once said "I pray all Americans who have seen and felt the meltdown of America with the Obama years, to please fight for Donald Trump"

title: Did the Trump Administration's Policies Halt a Research Project Seeking an HIV Cure?
subtitle: A quietly instituted “pause” on the federal procurement of fetal tissue for biomedical research has halted, at least temporarily, a research project seeking a cure for HIV.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The Trump Administration's policies have halted a research effort seeking a cure for HIV.

title: Is This a Photograph of European Jews Protesting Deportation from the U.S. to Nazi Germany?
subtitle: The photograph shows Otto Richter, who escaped to the U.S. from Nazi Germany, only to face deportation three years later.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A photograph shows a couple protesting a Jewish man's deportation from the U.S. back to Nazi Germany.

title: Is This a Photograph of Robert Mueller Meeting with Viktor Yanukovych?
subtitle: It is neither unusual nor nefarious for an FBI director to meet with foreign leaders about shared security issues.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A photograph shows former FBI director Robert Mueller meeting with former Ukrainian president Viktor Yanukovych in 2013.

title: Did President Trump Kiss Bob Dole on the Forehead?
subtitle: Photographs sometimes don't capture the public's attention until later events make them noteworthy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Trump kissing former senator Bob Dole on the forehead.

title: Did President Trump Not Recite the Apostles' Creed During President Bush's Funeral?
subtitle: Some social media users questioned the sincerity of President Trump's religious beliefs as exhibited during George H.W. Bush's funeral.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump did not recite the Apostles' Creed as other attendees did during George H.W. Bush's funeral.

title: Did a Principal Ban Candy Canes Because They Are Shaped Like J's for 'Jesus'?
subtitle: The principal of Manchester Elementary in Nebraska was put on leave as a result of the candy cane controversy.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An elementary school principal in Nebraska banned candy canes from schoolrooms because they supposedly represent Jesus.

title: Is This 'Before and After' Image of an Earthquake-Damaged Alaskan Road Real?
subtitle: Sometimes much smaller road maintenance issues languish for years in an unfixed state, and then there's this.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a severely earthquake-damaged road in Alaska that was repaired in just a few days.

title: Did 33 Republicans Who Voted to Repeal Obamacare Lose Their Congressional Seats?
subtitle: Voting to repeal Obamacare may or may not have doomed the re-election chances of many Republicans in Congress.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Congressional seats of almost three dozen Republicans who voted to repeal Obamacare were lost to Democrats in 2018.

title: Did Fox News Display a 'Treason for the Season' Graphic?
subtitle: Some viewers saw the words "Treason for the Season" in a Fox News Christmas graphic due to the placement of a cross.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox aired a holiday graphic reading "Reason for the Season," which some viewers read as "Treason for the Season" due the placement of a cross.

title: Did a School Accidentally Give Students Pine-Sol Instead of Apple Juice?
subtitle: An assistant at a Honolulu school was fired after somehow confusing the cleaning liquid for a "snack."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Students at a school in Honolulu, Hawaii were accidentally given Pine-Sol fluid instead of apple juice.

title: Did Smirnoff Troll President Trump in a Vodka Advertisement?
subtitle: A genuine advertisement for Smirnoff vodka used the tagline "Made in America but we'd be happy to talk about our ties to Russia under oath."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an advertisement for Smirnoff vodka containing an apparent dig at President Trump.

title: Were Immigrants at the U.S.-Mexico Border Photographed with Numbers Written on Their Arms?
subtitle: A photograph taken near the border spurred disturbing comparisons to atrocities committed by Nazi Germany.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Three migrants at the U.S.-Mexico border were photographed with identification numbers written on their forearms.

title: Is the “Headless Chicken of the Deep Sea” a Real Creature?
subtitle: Enypniastes eximia is a sea cucumber that looks a bit like a “chicken just before you put it in an oven.”
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A video shows a sea cucumber that resembles a headless chicken.

title: Former President George H.W. Bush Has Died
subtitle: The 41st President of the U.S. has passed away at age 94, according to the family's spokesperson
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Former president George H.W. Bush has passed away at age 94.

title: Did a Male Rapist Who Identifies as Female Transfer to a Women's Jail and Assault Female Inmates?
subtitle: Karen White, formerly Stephen Woods, confessed not only to abusing fellow inmates in a West Yorkshire women's jail, but to committing rape years earlier when she still identified as a male.
author: David Emery
statement: Transgender prisoner Karen White (formerly Stephen Wood) of West Yorkshire, England, who confessed to committing multiple rapes as a man, sexually assaulted female inmates after being transferred to a women's jail.

title: Did a College Give Students Hockey Pucks to Use Against Mass Shootings?
subtitle: The unusual tactic was first suggested during a training session, but police said using a puck would be an "absolute last strategy."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Students and faculty at Oakland University were given hockey pucks to use in the event of a mass shooting attack.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Black Couple Accepting a Gift from KKK Members?
subtitle: The details behind a strange photograph taken in Alabama in 1948 remain elusive.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Jack and Rosie Riddle were photographed in 1948 accepting a radio from a group of Ku Klux Klan members.

title: Was Sen. Cindy Hyde-Smith Photographed Wearing a Confederate Soldier's Cap?
subtitle: The photographs of the Republican lawmaker were brought to light hours before a 20 November 2018 debate.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Sen. Cindy Hyde-Smith posted photographs of herself wearing a Confederate soldier's hat during a visit to the home of Jefferson Davis.

title: Did an English Woman Lie Dead at Home Undiscovered for Years?
subtitle: A meme referred to the tragic circumstances surrounding the death and discovery of Joyce Carol Vincent in 2006.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2006, the skeletal remains of Joyce Carol Vincent were found in her home, with the television on, years after her death.

title: Did Melania Trump's One-Day Trip to Toronto Cost $174,000 in Hotel Charges?
subtitle: The State Department spent $174,000 for hotel rooms in advance of a visit by the First Lady to Toronto, where she led a delegation for the Invictus Games.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Melania Trump's one-day visit to Toronto resulted in $174,000 in hotel charges.

title: Did a High School Volleyball Team Receive Money and New Gear After the Paradise Fire?
subtitle: A team from the devastated community of Paradise found support as well as competition in a memorable playoff game.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The Paradise Adventist Academy in California received around $13,000 in donations as well as new uniforms and clothes from an opponent in a game played shortly after their hometown was destroyed by the Camp Fire.

title: Were Some Voters' Absentee Ballots Returned as 'Undeliverable'?
subtitle: Reports out of Ohio and Georgia claimed that ballots mailed in government-provided envelopes were rejected by the USPS.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A voter in Chatham County, Georgia, had a mail-in ballot returned and listed as "undeliverable" even though it was addressed to a county-approved P.O. box.

title: Did the French, But Not Trump, Attend WW1 Services at Arlington National Cemetery?
subtitle: French officials participated in Veterans Day services at Arlington National Cemetery on the centennial of WW1's conclusion.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: President Trump did not attend Veterans Day services at Arlington National Cemetery marking the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I, but representatives of the French government did.

title: Did Stan Lee Condemn Bigotry and Racism in a Marvel Comics Column?
subtitle: In a 1968 op-ed, the comics pioneer called racial prejudice of any kind "patently insane."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: In his monthly column for Marvel Comics, Stan Lee wrote that "racism and bigotry are among the deadliest social ills plaguing the world today."

title: Did Parkland Shooter Nikolas Cruz Register to Vote as a Republican from Jail?
subtitle: Cruz, who has confessed to the shooting but has yet to be convicted, has a constitutional right to vote and used that right to vote as a Republican in July 2018.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Parkland Shooter Nikolas Cruz registered to vote as a Republican from jail.

title: Does This Photograph Show President Trump Visiting a WWI Cemetery in the Rain?
subtitle: President Trump was widely criticized for skipping a ceremony commemorating the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I due to the rain, but he did attend another event (also in the rain) to honor the occasion.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show President Trump commemorating the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I at a cemetery in the rain.

title: Was a Group of High Schoolers Photographed Performing a Nazi Salute?
subtitle: Officials launched an investigation into the photograph of Baraboo High School students after it was posted on Twitter.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Several male students at Baraboo High School were photographed performing the Nazi "Sieg Heil" salute.

title: Did an Undelivered Speech from JFK State That 'Our Duty as a Party is Not to Our Party Alone' But to 'All of Mankind?'
subtitle: The words of President John F. Kennedy that the world never got to hear.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A passage from a speech JFK was supposed to deliver on the day he was assassinated stated that "our duty as a party is not to our party alone, but to the Nation, and, indeed, to all mankind."

title: Free Meals for Military Personnel on Veterans Day
subtitle: A number of restaurant chains offer free meals to U.S. military personnel in conjunction with Veterans Day.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Restaurant chains are offering free meals to U.S. military personnel in conjunction with Veterans Day.

title: Did a Man Photobomb Mitch McConnell With a Thumbs-Down Gesture While They Voted?
subtitle: This isn't exactly what we mean when we refer to a "photo booth."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man giving Mitch McConnell a thumbs-down from the voting booth.

title: Did Joe Biden Say He Believes Illegal Immigrants Are “Already American Citizens”?
subtitle: Biden spoke in March 2014 in the context of initiatives aimed at extending President Obama's Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Vice President Joe Biden said that illegal immigrants are “already American citizens” to him.

title: Did a Billboard in Missouri Show President Trump Alongside a Gospel Quote?
subtitle: Some Christians expressed concern that a billboard near St. Louis seemingly equated the 45th president with Jesus Christ himself.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A billboard along route I-170 near St. Louis, Missouri showed President Donald Trump alongside an excerpt from a well-known Gospel verse.

title: Can Pardoned Felons Vote?
subtitle: A felon can regain the right to vote via a pardon, but most felons regain that right upon completion of their sentences. Such decisions vary from state to state.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Pardoned felons are allowed to vote.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Park Covered with Spider Webs?
subtitle: We become familiar with the term "mass ballooning event."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph show park ground in Australia covered with spider webs.

title: Did Muslim Groups Raise More than $190,000 for Pittsburgh Synagogue Shooting Victims?
subtitle: Widespread reports of the interfaith solidarity effort following an attack against the Tree of Life Synagogue were accurate.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: American Muslim groups raised more than $190,000 to benefit victims of the mass shooting attack at a Pittsburgh synagogue.

title: Is This a Real Photograph of a Man Holding a 'Homeless N*****s Go Back to Africa' Sign?
subtitle: The photograph is genuine, but the story behind it is significantly more complicated than it may appear at first glance.
author: David Emery
statement: A photograph shows a man standing on a street corner holding a large sign that reads "Homeless Niggers Go Back to Africa."

title: Did Pipe-Bombing Suspect Cesar Sayoc Attend Donald Trump Rallies?
subtitle: Video and photographic evidence establishes beyond doubt that Sayoc attended at least two Trump rallies, both during the 2016 campaign and after the president's inauguration.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Photographs and videos show pipe-bombing suspect Cesar Sayoc in attendance at Donald Trump rallies.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Car with a Message Supporting 'Public Executions' of Trump Critics?
subtitle: Photographs of the unidentified vehicle were posted online shortly after a suspect was arrested for allegedly targeting officials with mail bombs.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: An automobile in Florida was spotted bearing a statement expressing support for 'public executions' of Trump critics.

title: Does Stacey Abrams Owe More Than $50,000 in Back Taxes?
subtitle: A graphic criticizing the 2018 Georgia gubernatorial candidate was not inaccurate, but neither was it a "gotcha" moment.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: 2018 Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams owes more than $50,000 in back taxes to the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Did a 17-Year-Old Eagle Scout Build a Nuclear Reactor in His Mom's Backyard?
subtitle: The tale of a David Hahn, who earned a merit badge in atomic energy and then turned his backyard into a superfund site as he attempted to build a nuclear reactor there.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: In 1994, a 17-year-old Eagle Scout built a nuclear reactor in his mother's backyard, an act that ultimately necessitated a Superfund cleanup.

title: Did North Carolina Admit to Targeting Black Voters with a 'Voter ID' Law?
subtitle: Two academics brought to light the state's efforts to violate protections against "intentional discrimination."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: North Carolina admitted that a voter ID law was at least partly enacted in response to African-American voting tendencies that went against conservative interests.

title: Do These Photographs Show the Same Spot in the Arctic 100 Years Apart?
subtitle: A glacier comparison project documented some stark changes in the Arctic landscape across the span of a century.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image comparison shows the same spot in the Arctic in photographs taken over a century apart.

title: Is the U.S. No Longer One of the Top 20 Most Democratic Countries in the World?
subtitle: The research arm of The Economist magazine releases an annual “Democracy Index” ranking the strength of democracy in each country. The U.S. has not been in the top 20 since 2015.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The United States has “dropped off” a list of the 20 most democratic countries in the world.

title: School Shootings in Christian Texas vs. Non-Christian Japan
subtitle: A viral tweet, offered in response to remarks made by the Republican candidate in a Texas senatorial debate, gets the facts right.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The school shooting rate in non-Christian Japan is vastly lower than that of mostly Christian Texas.

title: Can Voters Ask for Provisional Ballots If They Are Turned Away at Polls?
subtitle: The vast majority of voters are entitled by federal law to demand a provisional ballot if they encounter problems at the ballot box.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: If voters are turned away from polls on election day, they can ask for a provisional ballot.

title: Has North Dakota Law Made It Harder for Native Americans to Vote?
subtitle: Critics of a series of voter ID restrictions have provided ample evidence that the laws would disproportionately affect Native Americans.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: H.B. 1369, a North Dakota voter ID law, includes restrictions that disproportionately affect Native American voters.

title: Did Cardinal George Pell Say Abortion Was Worse Than Sexual Abuse of Children?
subtitle: The head of the Vatican's Secretariat for the Economy has declined to backtrack on his controversial July 2002 statement.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Cardinal George Pell, who has been charged with sexual abuse, once said that abortion was "a worse moral scandal than priests sexually abusing young people."

title: Did Trump Offer $1 Million If Elizabeth Warren Could Show Native American Heritage?
subtitle: The president denied making the offer, but video from a July 2018 speech seemingly demonstrates otherwise.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump offered to donate $1 million to a charity of Sen. Elizabeth Warren's choice if she would take a DNA test to demonstrate that she had Native American ancestry.

title: Does This Photograph Show Neo-Nazis Posing Under a Burning Swastika in Draketown, Georgia?
subtitle: An extraordinary photograph from an April 2018 rally re-emerged on social media several months later.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A photograph shows American neo-Nazis performing a Nazi salute in front of a burning swastika in Draketown, Georgia, in 2018.

title: Were Gay Concentration Camp Prisoners 'Put Back in Prison' After World War II?
subtitle: An online comedy series highlighted the fact that the end of the war did not mean the end of persecution for many gay German men.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Gay men incarcerated in Nazi concentration camps during World War II were forced back into prison even after the Allied forces won that conflict.

title: Is Mylan CEO Heather Bresch the Daughter of W.V. Democratic Senator Joe Manchin?
subtitle: A meme about Manchin's vote to confirm Kavanaugh accurately notes that Heather Bresch is Manchin's daughter, but it's not clear why that's relevant.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Heather Bresch is the daughter of West Virgnia Democrat Joe Manchin.

title: Did a Virginia School Leave a Transgender Student Unprotected During a Shooting Drill?
subtitle: An activist group's account of the incident at Stafford County Middle School spread rapidly online.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Instructors at a Virginia middle school did not allow a transgender student to take shelter during a drill simulating how to hide from a school shooter.

title: Did a School Employee Tweet 'Who's Gonna Take One for the Team and Kill Kavanaugh?'
subtitle: A paraprofessional with Rosemount, Minnesota, school district resigned after posting the tweet.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Minnesota education worker asked on Twitter whether someone would "take one for the team" by killing a newly-confirmed Supreme Court justice.

title: Did Lindsey Graham Say Republicans Would Get 'Destroyed' If They Nominated Donald Trump?
subtitle: Senator Lindsey Graham may have been one of President Trump's biggest supporters in 2018, but that wasn't the case during the 2016 presidential election.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Senator Lindsey Graham once said that Republicans would "get destroyed" if they nominated Donald Trump as their presidential candidate.

title: Was Maya Angelou Sexually Assaulted as a Child?
subtitle: A graphic shared online relays details that Angelou first revealed in her 1969 autobiography, "I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Maya Angelou was raped when she was a child, and after the man responsible was found dead, she refused to speak for nearly 5 years.

title: Was a GoFundMe Page Established for Brett Kavanaugh?
subtitle: Several GoFundMe accounts were opened in the Supreme Court nominee's name during his Senate confirmation hearings, raising more than $600,000 in donations.
author: David Emery
statement: A GoFundMe page was established to collect donations for embattled Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh.

title: Did President Trump Board Air Force One with Paper Stuck to His Shoe?
subtitle: A mildly embarrassing moment on the president's trip to Minnesota was greeted with amusement and schadenfreude by some.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: While boarding Air Force One in Minneapolis, Minnesota, on 4 October 2018, President Donald Trump had paper stuck to his shoe.

title: Could a Case Currently Before the Supreme Court Result in a Stronger Presidential Pardon?
subtitle: Gamble v. United States concerns a felon who was arrested for possession of a firearm. It could also have significant bearing on the President's much vaunted pardon power.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Judge Kavanaugh, if confirmed to the Supreme Court, could be a deciding vote on a case that has the potential to dramatically increase the power of the presidential pardon.

title: Is This 'Back to the Future' Image Comparison with President Trump Real?
subtitle: An image comparison featuring Donald Trump and Biff Tannen from the movie "Back to the Future" has not been digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image comparison shows Donald Trump and various politicians in similar poses to characters from the movie "Back to the Future."

title: Was the Arch of Baal Erected in Washington Before Christine Blasey Ford's Testimony?
subtitle: The Arch of Palmyra appeared on the National Mall, but its relationship to Senate Judiciary Committee hearings was purely coincidental.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the Arch of Baal erected on the National Mall in Washington, D.C.

title: Is This a Photograph of Donald Trump's Mother?
subtitle: Although some claim that Donald Trump wears a wig, an image of his mother Mary suggests that the presidential pompadour runs in the family.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An photograph shows Donald Trump's mother, Mary Anne MacLeod Trump.

title: Did Amazon Pay No Federal Income Taxes in 2017?
subtitle: By the company's own accounting, Amazon actually received a $137 million federal tax credit in the same year they earned over $5.6 billion in profit.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Amazon paid zero dollars in federal income tax in 2017.

title: Did President Trump Say 'I Met with the President of the Virgin Islands?'
subtitle: In a 2017 speech, Trump referred to Kenneth Mapp, governor of the U.S. Virgin Islands, as the territory's 'president.'
author: David Emery
statement: President Trump said "I met with the president of the Virgin Islands," a U.S. territory of which Trump is the chief of state.

title: Did Paul Gosar's Siblings Appear in a Political Ad Endorsing His Opponent?
subtitle: We've all heard of sibling rivalry, but politics can take that phenomenon to a whole different level.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Six of Arizona Rep. Paul Gosar's siblings appeared in a political commercial endorsing his opponent, David Brill.

title: Did Alex Smith Die at Age 26 Because He Couldn't Afford Insulin?
subtitle: The Minneapolis man suffered from type 1 diabetes and had begun rationing his insulin because he couldn't pay for the prescription.
author: David Emery
statement: A 26-year-old man named Alex Smith of Minneapolis died because he had aged out of his mother's health insurance and couldn't afford insulin.

title: Is Performing Pelvic Exams on Unconscious Women Without Informed Consent Legal?
subtitle: Despite widespread condemnation of the practice, performing pelvic exams on unconscious women for medical training, without explicit consent, is legal in 45 states.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: In 45 states, doctors and medical students are legally allowed to practice pelvic exams on patients who are under anesthesia without being granted explicit consent to do so.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Stretch of I-40 in North Carolina Underwater?
subtitle: A photograph documents that a portion of Interstate 40 in North Carolina was completely underwater after Hurricane Florence.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph documents that a portion of Interstate 40 in North Carolina was completely underwater after Hurricane Florence.

title: Did Ted Cruz's Campaign Send Fundraising Mailers That Resemble Legal Summonses?
subtitle: Despite allegations that the fundraising letters were misleading, federal officials said that the "summonses" did not violate election law.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Sen. Ted Cruz's campaign has sent fundraising letters with an envelope made up to resemble a legal summons.

title: Did George Zimmerman Sign a Bag of Skittles?
subtitle: An image showing a bag of Skittles autographed by George Zimmerman came from the documentary "Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a bag of Skittles signed by George Zimmerman.

title: Does This Photograph Show 'Brittany L' After Killing a Leopard?
subtitle: A photograph posted by Safari Club International went viral after being shared by outraged animal-lovers.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A photograph shows a woman named "Brittany L" on a hunting expedition, holding a recently-killed leopard.

title: Weather Channel Reporter Braces in Storm That Leaves Others Unaffected
subtitle: A video clip of a report captured during Hurricane Florence appeared to show some very selective heavy winds.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video clip shows a Weather Channel reporter struggling against hurricane winds that seemingly did not affect other persons nearby.

title: Did the National Association of Police Organizations Call for a Boycott of Nike?
subtitle: The police union's president called Colin Kaepernick a "shallow dilettante" who disrespected the American flag in a letter to Nike's CEO.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The National Association of Police Organizations called on its members to boycott Nike after the company announced a commercial deal with Colin Kaepernick.

title: Did NRATV Digitally Add Ku Klux Klan Hoods to Thomas the Tank Engine Characters?
subtitle: An NRA television segment hosted by Dana Loesch caused controversy in September 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2018, Dana Loesch hosted an NRA television segment that showed Thomas the Tank Engine characters wearing digitally-added Ku Klux Klan hoods.

title: Did Colin Kaepernick Donate $25,000 to a Group Honoring Assata Shakur?
subtitle: The group is named after the Black Liberation Army member who was convicted in the murder of a state trooper and fled to Cuba.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Colin Kaepernick made a $25,000 donation to an activist group named after Assata Shakur, who was convicted in the murder of a police officer.

title: Has Warrick Dunn Built More Than 145 Homes for Single Parents?
subtitle: 'If you are going to live in this community, you want to be a part of this community and give back.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: Warrick Dunn started a charitable program to house single-parent families in honor of his mother, a police officer who was killed when he was a teenager.

title: Were Immigrant Teenagers Strapped to Chairs with Bags Over Their Heads?
subtitle: Immigrant children as young as 14 were forcibly restrained at a Virginia facility, but authorities consider the methods acceptable.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Detained immigrant children were strapped to chairs with bags over their heads.

title: Does This Photograph Show Barron Trump Wearing Nike Shoes?
subtitle: An ongoing controversy over Nike's endorsement deal with Colin Kaepernick expanded to include an old photograph of the president's 12-year-old son.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: President Donald Trump's son Barron was once photographed wearing Nike brand shoes.

title: Did Trump Once Criticize the Obama White House for 'Attacking' Bob Woodward?
subtitle: A Donald Trump tweet from 2013 about the Obama administration and reporter Bob Woodward was seized on by the president's critics in 2018.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump once wrote that "only the Obama White House can get away with attacking Bob Woodward."

title: Was John McCain's Body Carried to Washington on Air Force Two?
subtitle: The aircraft normally designated “Air Force Two” carried John McCain and his family to Washington, D.C.  on the late senator's final flight across the country.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Senator John McCain's remains were carried to Washington, D.C., on a Boeing C-32A airplane commonly used as "Air Force Two."

title: Did President Trump Say “Everybody Would Be Very Poor” If He Were Impeached?
subtitle: The chief executive asserted that if the country were deprived of his thinking, markets would crash and everyone would be poor as a result.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: President Trump said that “everybody would be very poor” if he were impeached.

title: Did Bill Gates, Steve Jobs, and Other Tech Billionaire Parents Advocate Limiting Children's Technology Use?
subtitle: A number of tech billionaires seemingly agree on at least one piece of parenting advice: Limit your children's use of technology.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Tech billionaires such as Bill Gates and Steve Jobs advocated limiting children's use of technology.

title: Did a Twitter User Jeopardize Her NASA Internship by Insulting a Member of the National Space Council?
subtitle: A screenshot captured a NASA intern's injudicious Twitter exchange with a member of the National Space Council.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Twitter user jeopardized her NASA internship after unknowingly insulting a member of the National Space Council.

title: Did Sen. Lindsey Graham Call Trump a 'Race-Baiting, Xenophobic Bigot' in 2015?
subtitle: An online graphic accurately quoted the South Carolina Republican disparaging his then-opponent on CNN.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Sen. Lindsey Graham called President Donald Trump a "race-baiting xenophobic bigot" in 2015 but in 2018 claimed that he had "never heard him make a single racist statement."

title: Did Verizon Wireless Throttle a Fire Department's Data Service During a Wildfire?
subtitle: Firefighters in Santa Clara, California, revealed that they were forced to buy a more expensive service package due to a company "mistake."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Verizon Wireless limited the Santa Clara County Fire Department's data access by "throttling" their service in the midst of a wildfire.

title: Did Robert Smalls Steal a Confederate Ship to Rescue Himself and Others from Slavery?
subtitle: A meme accurately recounts the life of a man born into slavery who stole a Confederate ship to rescue fellow slaves, became a war hero, and got elected to the U.S. Congress.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A man named Robert Smalls escaped slavery, along with his family and other slaves, by stealing a Confederate ship and was later elected to the U.S. House of Representatives.

title: Did Two Police Officers Cook Dinner for Children After Their Mother Was Taken to the Hospital?
subtitle: An image of two police officers washing the dishes after they cooked a meal for a sick mother's children is real and was taken in the Netherlands in 2015.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Two police officers cooked a meal and washed the dishes for a group of children after their mother was taken to the hospital.

title: Was William Harvey Carney the First Black Medal of Honor Recipient?
subtitle: A pro-Trump Facebook group used Carney's real-life military efforts to criticize current NFL player protests.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: William Harvey Carney was the first African-American serviceman to be awarded the Medal of Honor.

title: Did Fox News Use an Image of Patti LaBelle During Their Aretha Franklin Tribute?
subtitle: Fox News accidentally included a photograph of singer Patti LaBelle instead of Aretha Franklin as they reported on the latter's  passing.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox News included an image of singer Patti LaBelle instead of Aretha Franklin in a tribute piece after the latter's passing.

title: Does This Photograph Show the Cooking Instructions on a Bacon Package?
subtitle: The instructions on the back label of a bacon package advised consumers to "complain to elected officials" if they "don't know how to cook bacon."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The cooking instructions on a bacon package advised consumers to "contact your elected officials and complain" if they "don't know how to cook bacon."

title: Were Additional Donald Trump 'Stars' Placed on the Hollywood Walk of Fame?
subtitle: A group of right-wing street artists called "The Faction" posted a video claiming responsibility for the stunt in August 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2018, adhesive replicas of President Donald Trump's recently-destroyed star were placed on the Walk of Fame on Hollywood Boulevard.

title: Are These 'I'd Rather Be a Russian Than a Democrat' Shirts Real?
subtitle: A photograph of two men wearing "I'd Rather Be a Russian Than a Democrat" t-shirts was taken at a rally for President Trump in Ohio.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two men wearing "I'd Rather Be a Russian Than a Democrat" shirts at a rally for President Trump.

title: Does This Video Show Baby Spiders Dispersing from Their Recently Squashed Mother?
subtitle: Be careful you don't end up with more than you bargained for when you go after household invaders.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows dozens of spiderlings dispersed from their mother after she was squashed with a broom.

title: Did Barack Obama Express Opposition to 'Undetected, Undocumented, Unchecked' Immigration?
subtitle: A 13-year-old quotation from the former Illinois Senator was reintroduced into public debate in the context of President Donald Trump's "zero tolerance" policy.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2005, Senator Barack Obama expressed his opposition to "undetected, undocumented, unchecked" immigration.

title: Did the Obama Administration Approve the Transfer of Money to a Listed Terrorism Funder?
subtitle: An investigation into U.S. international aid practises in 2015 hit the headlines in July 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The Obama administration approved the transfer of funding to the Islamic Relief Agency, a Sudan-based organization with ties to Al-Qaeda.

title: Twosday? Will 2/22/2022 Really Fall on a Tuesday?
subtitle: The 22nd day of the 2nd month of the year 2022 will fall on a Tuesday, thus creating a robust "twosday."
author: Dan Evon
statement: The 22nd day of the 2nd month of the year 2022 will fall on a Tuesday.

title: Is the Hammerhead Bat a Real Animal?
subtitle: A photograph showing an odd-looking, large bat with an elongated face features a real animal, but the image may make the bat appear larger than normal.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph showing an odd-looking, large bat with an elongated face known as a "hammerhead bat."

title: Does This Photograph Show the Water Filtration Power of Oysters?
subtitle: Oysters sustain themselves by sucking microscopic plankton out of the waters they inhabit, and this behavior also turns them into natural water filters.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: One oyster can filter more than 50 gallons of water in 24 hours.

title: Did an Arizona State Senate Candidate Fatally Shoot His Mother?
subtitle: Republican Bobby Wilson brought up a dark chapter from his past during a public debate about gun control in July 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Arizona State Senate candidate Bobby Wilson fatally shot his mother in 1963.

title: Did a TEDx Speaker Say Pedophilia Is an 'Unchangeable Sexual Orientation'?
subtitle: A TEDx talk broadcast from Germany prompted widespread controversy over the speaker's comments about the nature of pedophilia.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A TEDx speaker gave a talk that referred to pedophilia as an 'unchangeable sexual orientation.'

title: Did Missouri Republicans Pass a Law Lowering the St. Louis Minimum Wage from $10 to $7.70?
subtitle: Missouri's Republican-controlled state legislature passed a law in May 2017 rolling back a minimum wage increase enacted by the city of St. Louis.
author: David Emery
statement: Missouri Republicans passed a bill to lower the minimum wage in St. Louis from $10 an hour to $7.70.

title: Did an Obese Man Survive Without Eating for 382 Days?
subtitle: In 1965, an obese man actually survived without eating for over a year, living entirely off his body fat and supplemental vitamins.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: In 1965 a 'grossly obese' man survived without eating for one year and 17 days, living entirely off his body fat and supplemental vitamins.

title: Did Elizabeth Holtzman Send DHS Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen a Strongly-Worded Resignation?
subtitle: The former Democratic Congresswomen accused the Department of Homeland Security of "making war on immigrants and refugees" in a letter that went viral in July 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In July 2018, former Congresswoman Elizabeth Holtzman wrote a strongly-worded letter of resignation from the Homeland Security Advisory Council which went viral on social media.

title: Did a Portland Art Gallery Display an Artwork Depicting President Trump's Throat Being Slit?
subtitle: The controversial artwork was removed from the gallery's window after the business received numerous threats over it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Portland at gallery displayed an artwork that depicted President Trump's throat being slit with a knife.

title: Did a Russian Asbestos Company Put Trump's Face on Their Product?
subtitle: A Russian asbestos producer shared a photograph of their product to social media with a seal of Donald Trump's face and the text "Approved by Donald Trump”.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A Russian asbestos company placed a seal with the face of President Donald Trump on their product with the note "Approved by Donald Trump, 45th President of the United States."

title: Is the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas Suing Mass Shooting Victims?
subtitle: MGM Resorts International, the parent company of Mandalay Bay, argues they are not responsible for the 2017 Route 91 Harvest Festival massacre.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Mandalay Bay, the Las Vegas hotel from which a gunman opened fire on a concert crowd of 20,000, filed lawsuits against mass shooting victims.

title: Are Federal HIV Treatment Funds Being Used for Immigrant Internment?
subtitle: The department of Health and Human Services confirmed the request to redirect the "unused" funding.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The Department of Health and Human Services requested that funding for the Ryan White HIV/AIDS Program be used for detainment of immigrant children.

title: Has the Trump Administration Launched an Immigrant 'Denaturalization' Task Force?
subtitle: In June 2018, the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services announced they were staffing a new office targeting naturalized citizens who cheated on their applications.
author: David Emery
statement: A new U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services task force is charged with identifying naturalized citizens who cheated on their applications and seeking the revocation of their citizenship, a process known as "denaturalization."

title: Did a Pride of Lions Kill and Eat a Suspected Poacher in South Africa?
subtitle: A travel web site got the basic facts right about the gruesome death of David Baloyi in February 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In February 2018, a pride of lions killed and ate a man suspected of being a poacher near Kruger National Park in South Africa.

title: Did a Man Harass a Woman for Wearing a 'Puerto Rico' T-Shirt in the United States?
subtitle: A Facebook Live video prompted widespread outrage and an internal investigation into the conduct of a Cook County, Illinois, police officer.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A viral video shows an Illinois man harassing a woman in a public park for wearing a t-shirt bearing the flag of Puerto Rico.

title: Did Trump Refer to His Mouth as a Musical Instrument 'Hopefully' Attached to the Brain?
subtitle: During a rally in Montana, President Trump went on a tangent about crowd size in which he compared his speeches to the performances of Sir Elton John.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: In a 2018 rally, President Trump compared his mouth to Elton John's organ, adding that the brain is “hopefully attached to the mouth.”

title: The Longest Total Lunar Eclipse of the 21st Century Will Occur on July 27
subtitle: Some record-setting moonside shade is on the books for late July 2018.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A lunar eclipse occurring on 27 July 2018 will be the longest duration total lunar eclipse of the 21st century.

title: Did a Python Swallow a Woman in Indonesia?
subtitle: Experts have authenticated video footage showing the aftermath of a deadly snake attack in June 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2018, a reticulated python swallowed and killed a woman in an Indonesian village.

title: Do Children in Immigration Proceedings Have No Right to Court-Appointed Representation?
subtitle: A June 2018 news report accurately described the controversial reality of children facing deportation proceedings without legal representation.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Children in immigration court do not have the right to free, court-appointed attorneys.

title: Could Maxine Waters Subpoena Trump's Bank Records If Democrats Take the House?
subtitle: Maxine Waters is in line to become chair of the House Financial Services Committee if Democrats take that chamber  - a position that comes with broad subpoena powers.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: If Democrats gain a majority in the House of Representatives,  Maxine Waters could become chair of a committee that has the power to subpoena President Trump's bank records.

title: Did a Priest in France Slap a Baby During a Baptism Ceremony?
subtitle: Disturbing video footage of the incident went viral in June 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2018, a priest in France slapped a baby in the face during a baptism.

title: Did an Oregon Department of Transportation Employee Say That Immigrants Should be 'Shot at the Border'?
subtitle: Lori McAllen has faced a backlash after screenshots emerged of her calling for immigrants to be shot during an online debate over the Trump administration's immigration policy.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2018, Oregon DOT employee Lori McAllen said immigrants into the United States should be shot at the border with Mexico.

title: Is the Trump Administration Paying Southwest Key $458 Million to Run Immigrant Child Detention Centers?
subtitle: Southwest Key's chief executive officer earned an annual salary of $1.5 million in 2016.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Trump administration is paying Southwest Key $458 million to run immigrant child detention centers, and its CEO earns a $1.5 million salary.

title: Did Melania Trump Wear This Jacket on Her Way to Visit Children Separated from Their Families?
subtitle: The First Lady made a surprise visit to detained immigrant children while wearing a jacket bearing the message "I DON'T REALLY CARE DO U?" on the back.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: First Lady Melania Trump wore a jacket with "I DON'T REALLY CARE DO U?" emblazoned on the back on her way to visit immigrant kids.

title: Did a Flight Attendant Post an Account of a Redeye Flight Full of Unaccompanied Migrant Children?
subtitle: An anonymous Facebook post described what it was like to accompany sixteen "scared little souls" on a cross-country flight to a detention facility in the middle of the night.
author: David Emery
statement: Facebook posts by commercial flight attendants describe their experiences working on flights transporting unaccompanied immigrant children to detention facilities.

title: Is Stephen Miller a Descendant of Asylum Seekers Who Fled Anti-Semitic Violence?
subtitle: The White House senior advisor is the great-grandson of a Jewish immigrant who fled the poverty and pogroms of the Russian Empire in the early 1900s.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Stephen Miller - a principal architect of the Trump administration's immigration policy - is the descendant of asylum seekers who escaped anti-Jewish persecution in Eastern Europe.

title: Did Peter Fonda Suggest That Barron Trump Should Be Kidnapped?
subtitle: The actor apologized for saying Donald Trump's 12-year-old son should be put in "a cage with pedophiles" as a protest against the president's immigration policy.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2018, the actor Peter Fonda suggested in a tweet that Barron Trump should be kidnapped, as a protest against the president's immigration policy.

title: Did Methodists Bring Church Charges Against Jeff Sessions?
subtitle: Hundreds of the Attorney General's fellow church-members signed a letter claiming his "zero-tolerance" immigration policy had harmed "thousands of vulnerable humans."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2018, members of the United Methodist Church brought church charges, including child abuse, against Attorney General Jeff Sessions.

title: Did the Obama Administration Place Immigrant Children With Human Traffickers?
subtitle: A congressional report and criminal indictment resulted from a 2014 incident in which multiple immigrant children were handed off to a human trafficking ring.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Some immigrant children were placed with human traffickers during the Obama administration.

title: Did President Trump Say That Canadians Smuggle Shoes Out of the United States?
subtitle: Footwear manufacturers called the president "misinformed" after his appearance at a business group's event.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump said that Canadians "smuggle" shoes out of the United States after altering them to make them "look old."

title: Does 'Incredibles 2' Come With an Epilepsy Warning?
subtitle: The Disney-Pixar animated sequel has prompted safety concerns among some viewers.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The animated film "Incredibles 2" contains scenes that prompted an epilepsy warning at movie theaters.

title: Did President Trump Salute a North Korean General?
subtitle: Video footage released by North Korea's state television network shows Trump returning a military salute.
author: David Emery
statement: While greeting North Korean dignitaries during his summit meeting with Chairman Kim Jong Un, President Trump returned the military salute of a North Korean general.

title: Is Domino's Pizza Paving Roads?
subtitle: A new funding initiative by the restaurant chain caused surprise and skepticism in mid-2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In mid-2018, Domino's Pizza began giving cities and towns grants for street repairs.

title: Does This Photograph Show Two Boys - One Vaccinated, One Not - Who Were Exposed to Smallpox?
subtitle: In the early 1900s, Allan Warner documented several cases of smallpox and the effects of vaccinations.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the dramatic differences in two boys who were exposed to the same smallpox source.

title: Did an Iowa Congressman Retweet a White Supremacist?
subtitle: Rep. Steve King engaged in yet another round of white nationalist speech on his Twitter account.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Rep. Steve King (R-Iowa) retweeted a post by a known white supremacist.

title: Did Bill Maher Say He Hopes for a Recession 'to Get Rid of Trump'?
subtitle: The always-provocative HBO talk show host stands accused of taking "Trump-hatred" to a whole new level.
author: David Emery
statement: Comedian and talk show host Bill Maher said he hopes an economic recession will occur because it's a way to get rid of President Trump."

title: Did Pierre Trudeau Say of Richard Nixon, 'I Have Been Called Worse Things by Better People'?
subtitle: When President Donald Trump lashed out at Canadian leader Justin Trudeau, a quote attributed to Trudeau's father after he was insulted by another United States president spread on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: When Canadian Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau learned that Richard Nixon had insulted him he responded, "I have been called worse things by better people."

title: Is This a Real Photograph of G7 Leaders?
subtitle: A German photographer covering the G7 summit captured an image of U.S. President Trump seemingly taking a posture of opposition to other world leaders.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump was photographed during the G7 summit sitting down opposite Germany prime minister Angela Merkel with his arms crossed.

title: Are More Than 10,000 Children in U.S. Detention Centers?
subtitle: The Department of Health and Human Services announced that 10,773 unaccompanied immigrant children were indeed in detention facilities as of May 2018.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: As of May 2018, there were more than 10,000 unaccompanied children in United States government immigration detention centers.

title: Did Ronald Reagan Warn Against 'Demagogues' Willing to Declare a Trade War Against America's Friends?
subtitle: During a 1988 radio address, President Reagan railed against those calling for trade tariffs and derided protectionism as "a cheap form of nationalism."
author: David Emery
statement: President Reagan warned the public against demagogues who advocated a trade war against America's friendly trading partners in the name of protectionism.

title: Did Paul Krugman Say the Internet's Effect on the World Economy Would Be 'No Greater Than the Fax Machine's'?
subtitle: In a 1998 article about the pitfalls of making predictions about technological progress, the Nobel Prize-winning economist questioned the future role of the Internet.
author: David Emery
statement: Economist Paul Krugman wrote that by 2005, it would become clear that the Internet's effect on the economy is no greater than the fax machine's.

title: Did a Georgia Lawmaker Tweet a Photograph of Nazis on D-Day?
subtitle: Rep. Drew Ferguson posted, and then deleted, an image with German soldiers from his Twitter account.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Rep. Drew Ferguson posted a picture of Nazi soldiers on Twitter on the anniversary of the Allied invasion of Normandy.

title: Do People Really Wear Live, Jewel-Encrusted Beetles as Brooches?
subtitle: A viral video shows people wearing jewelry consisting of what appear to be live beetles decorated with gold and gemstones.
author: David Emery
statement: There is a type of "living brooch" made and sold in Mexico consisting of a live beetle coated in gold and gemstones.

title: Did President Trump Donate His First-Quarter 2018 Salary to the Department of Veterans Affairs?
subtitle: In keeping with his campaign promise to forgo a presidential salary, the White House announced in May 2018 that Trump is donating $100,000 to Veterans Affairs.
author: David Emery
statement: In May 2018 President Trump donated one-fourth of his $400,000-per-year salary to the Department of Veterans Affairs.

title: Does a Video Game Allow Players to Assume the Role of a School Shooter?
subtitle: Survivors of mass shootings and those who have lost loved ones in them condemned the game "Active Shooter" ahead of its planned June 2018 release.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A video game set to be released in June 2018 allowed players to assume the role of a school shooter.

title: Did the U.S. Government Lose Track of 1,475 Migrant Children?
subtitle: An official from Health and Human Services reported to a Senate subcommittee that 1,475 unaccompanied migrant children are unaccounted for.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The U.S. government lost track of some 1,475 immigrant children who were placed in sponsor homes.

title: Was Sarah Huckabee Sanders Voted Among the 'Most Admired' Women in the United States?
subtitle: A pro-Trump Facebook page accurately alludes to the results of an April 2018 survey from YouGov.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2018, White House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders was listed as one of the 10 "most admired" women in the United States.

title: Does This Video Show a Thwarted Mother's Day Robbery?
subtitle: A compelling video captured an off-duty female Brazilian police officer shooting and subduing an armed robber.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Video captures a woman who thwarted and subdued an armed man attempting to rob attendees of a Mother's Day event.

title: Did Ayatollah Khamenei Share a Picture of Himself Reading 'Fire and Fury'?
subtitle: An image apparently showing Iran's Supreme Leader reading Michael Wolff's controversial book about U.S. President Donald Trump is authentic.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei shared a photo of himself reading Michael Wolff's "Fire and Fury."

title: Did the U.S. Navy Shoot Down an Iranian Passenger Jet in 1988, Killing 290 Civilians?
subtitle: The USS Vincennes shot down Iran Air flight 655, killing all 290 civilians aboard in one of the worst naval accidents in U.S. history.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: In 1988, the U.S. Navy shot down an Iranian passenger jet, killing 290 civilians; Some members of the crew that shot the plane down were later awarded medals, and the United States has not formally apologized for the event.

title: Donald Trump Explains Why Lincoln Succeeded
subtitle: This was indeed Donald Trump's answer to an interview question, for whatever that's worth.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme reproduces Donald Trump's explanation of why Abraham Lincoln succeeded as a president.

title: Is the Shoebill Stork a Real Animal?
subtitle: Images and videos of the shoebill stork, a large African bird, are often met with skepticism.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a real animal called the shoebill stork.

title: Was a Weapon Advertised For Its Ability to Fit in a Backpack?
subtitle: A photograph of a gun displayed in a clear plastic backpack is real.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An arms dealer advertised a weapon for its ability to fit into a small backpack.

title: Did Maryland 'Deplorables' Erect a Billboard Warning About Attempts to Impeach Donald Trump?
subtitle: A viral photograph shows a real roadside sign near Huntingtown in Calvert County which warns "liberals" to arm themselves.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A sign in Calvert County, Maryland was erected in May 2018, warning "liberals" to arm themselves in the event of attempts to impeach President Donald Trump.

title: Does the Honey Browser Extension Work?
subtitle: Is the browser extension Honey (which automatically applies coupons and finds deals) real or a scam?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The browser extension Honey provides coupons for online shoppers and enables consumers to accrue purchase rebates.

title: Is Trump Nominating Dr. Oz to the Presidential Council on Sport, Fitness and Nutrition?
subtitle: In early May 2018, President Trump announced his intention to nominate the controversial doctor to the Presidential Council on Sport, Fitness and Nutrition.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: President Trump intends to nominate Dr. Oz to the Presidential Council on Sport, Fitness and Nutrition.

title: Is This a Real Video of an Arrow That Always Points to the Right?
subtitle: No computer-aided manipulation was used to create this video of an arrow that always points right, even when you spin it 180 degrees.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: An optical illusion allows a 3D arrow to appear as if it is always pointing in the same direction (with its mirror reflection showing the opposite direction), even when it is rotated 180 degrees.

title: Is a Neo-Nazi Running as a Republican for the U.S. Senate in California?
subtitle: Patrick Little has repeatedly expressed white supremacist views in his campaign, including calling for a United States "free from Jews."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Republican candidate for U.S. Senate in California, Patrick Little, has expressed anti-semitic views, including calling for a United States "free from Jews."

title: Did a Man Discover He Was Paying a Bridge's Electric Bill?
subtitle: A man's nightmare fight with an energy company to get them to stop charging his business for a Kentucky bridge's electrical usage is true.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A Kentucky business owner found out he had been paying the electric bills of an Ohio River bridge, in addition to his own, for five months.

title: Did Oklahoma Pass a Bill Making It Legal to Deny LGBT Adoptions?
subtitle: Legislation in Oklahoma may make it more difficult for gay and lesbian parents to adopt children.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Oklahoma passed legislation that would potentially allow agencies to refuse adoptions involving LGBT parents.

title: Did Mike Huckabee Complain About Michelle Wolf After Mocking 'Triggers' on Twitter?
subtitle: Two tweets by the former GOP presidential candidate were combined to highlight a discrepancy in his views regarding what should be considered comedy.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Mike Huckabee tweeted that the White House Correspondents Dinner "celebrated bullying" after inviting people to watch his own show unless they lacked a "sense of humor."

title: Did a Man Receive a $153,000 Hospital Bill After a Failed Selfie With a Rattlesnake?
subtitle: Venomous rattlesnake bites can be notoriously expensive to treat, thanks mainly to high drug costs and arcane insurance-hospital negotiations.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A man received a $153,000 hospital bill after a bite he sustained from a rattlesnake that he was attempting to take a selfie with.

title: Did an Ohio Gubernatorial Candidate Accept $20,000 from a Pro-Assad Group?
subtitle: Former Ohio Rep. Dennis Kucinich, a Democrat, disclosed he received the money as payment for a speech.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Democratic candidate for Ohio governor revealed he received $20,000 from a pro-Assad group.

title: Did a Game Show Contestant Need Help Distinguishing Horsepower From 'Llamathrust'?
subtitle: A viral meme shows a real moment of mental difficulty for one contestant on "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?"
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A contestant on "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire" needed audience assistance in defining "horsepower," as opposed to "llamathrust" and "zebraforce."

title: Was an Italian Economist Removed from a Plane for Doing Math That Looked Like 'Terrorism'?
subtitle: In 2016, economist Guido Menzio was escorted off a flight because the passenger next to him felt his differential equations looked suspicious.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Guido Menzio, an Italian economist, was removed from a plane because a fellow passenger thought the math problems he was working on looked suspicious.

title: Did Donald Trump Tweet Warnings About Obama Ordering Syrian Airstrikes?
subtitle: In 2013, Donald Trump issued multiple warnings to his predecessor about attacking Syria without congressional approval.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump leveled the same criticisms against President Barack Obama over Syrian strikes that were later used against him.

title: Did the Census Bureau Play a Role in the Internment of Japanese Americans During World War II?
subtitle: Objections to questions about citizenship on 2020 census forms stem from fears that the data might be shared with other agencies, as reportedly took place in World War II.
author: David Emery
statement: Information shared with other agencies by the U.S. Census Bureau helped the government target Japanese Americans for relocation and internment during World War II.

title: Were Two Black Men Arrested for Waiting at a Starbucks?
subtitle: Philadelphia police are investigating an incident captured in a viral Facebook video.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video shows two black men being arrested while waiting for a friend at a Starbucks.

title: Did a Radio Host Tweet About Sodomizing a Parkland Survivor With a 'Hot Poker'?
subtitle: St. Louis "media personality" Jamie Allman wrote that he was "getting ready to ram a hot poker up David Hogg's ass."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Jamie Allman tweeted about sodomizing Parkland shooting survivor and activist David Hogg with a hot poker.

title: Is Homeland Security Working to Compile a Database of Journalists and Bloggers?
subtitle: A solicitation put out by the United States Department of Homeland Security seeks a contractor to collect data on social media influencers and media outlets.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The United States Department of Homeland Security is planning to compile a database of journalists and bloggers.

title: Did an Illinois Suburb Enact a Ban on Assault Weapons?
