title: Letter to General Motors
subtitle: A caustic letter from the president of Knox Machinery took the president of General Motors to task for seeking a government bailout.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The president of Knox Machinery wrote a letter to the president of General Motors, criticizing the latter for seeking a government bailout.

title: Can You Get Chagas Disease from Kissing Bugs?
subtitle: News from 2014 and 2017 reports that "kissing bugs" or "barber beetles" in the U.S. carry a disease-causing parasite.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Kissing bugs in the U.S. carry a disease-causing parasite.

title: Did a Soldier Return From Deployment to Find Their Family Dead?
subtitle: The horrifying homecoming is a long-running legend that might be based on a true tragedy.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A soldier returning from deployment discovered his wife had died during his absence, and their children had starved to death.

title: Drug-Running Boat
subtitle: Photograph shows a 2000-horsepower drug-smuggling boat bearing eight outboard motors.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a 2000-horsepower drug-smuggling boat with eight outboard motors.

title: Can Lionesses Grow Manes?
subtitle: Female lions' growing manes is not common, and scientists are unclear on the cause, but the phenomenon has been documented.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Under certain conditions, lionesses can grow manes and develop "masculine behavior".

title: Did President Trump's Grandfather Beg the Government of Bavaria Not to Deport Him?
subtitle: “Why should we be deported? This is very, very hard for a family," wrote Friedrich Trump in 1905.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: President Trump's grandfather Friedrich unsuccessfully petitioned the government of Bavaria (now southeast Germany) not to deport him and his family.

title: 'Livin' on the Edge' Truck Accident
subtitle: Photographs show a truck that crashed through a highway barrier and jumped a culvert on the edge of a cliff.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a truck that crashed through a highway barrier and skirted a culvert on the edge of a cliff.

title: Did a Kentucky Lawmaker Introduce a Bill Requiring Men to Get Wives' Permission to Take Viagra?
subtitle: Rep. Mary Lou Marzian, who is also a registered nurse, joked that she introduced the tongue-in-cheek 2016 legislation 'to protect these men from themselves.'
author: David Emery
statement: A 2016 bill before the Kentucky legislature would have required men to get their wives' permission before obtaining a prescription for Viagra or other erectile dysfunction drug.

title: Did President Lyndon B. Johnson Applaud the Smothers Brothers for Mocking Him?
subtitle: An image shows a kind letter supposedly sent to the Smothers Brothers by LBJ about their repeated mocking of him.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Lyndon B. Johnson sent a letter to the Smothers Brothers for making Americans laugh by mocking him on their show.

title: The Definition of 'Trumpery'
subtitle: Spoiler alert: The dictionary definition of the word 'trumpery' employs such expressions as 'deceit,' 'fraud,' and 'showy but worthless.'
author: David Emery
statement: The English word "trumpery," which derives from a French word meaning "to deceive," is defined in the dictionary as "showy but worthless."

title: Has a Russian Spy Ship Been Spotted Near the East Coast of the United States?
subtitle: The vessel has been seen near the state of Delaware, but has violated no laws as it remains in international waters.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Russian spy ship has been spotted off the east coast of the United States.

title: Does the United States Deport Military Veterans?
subtitle: Honorably-discharged veterans of the U.S. military have, under certain circumstances, either received deportation orders or been deported.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The United States is deporting military veterans.

title: Is SpaceX Sending a Deadly Pathogen to the International Space Station?
subtitle: SpaceX is transporting an experiment that hopes to document genetic mutations to MRSA as a way to predict mechanisms of antibiotic resistance.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: SpaceX will be transporting a potentially deadly pathogen to the International Space Station as part of their next launch.

title: Lunar Eclipses Happen Only During Full Moons
subtitle: Despite headlines suggesting otherwise, the coincidence of a full moon and a lunar eclipse is not a rare spectacle; it's a scientific requirement.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Lunar eclipses happen only during full moons.

title: DeVos Family Campaign Contributions
subtitle: A chart purportedly shows how much money Betsy DeVos and her family contributed to Republican senators.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Betsy DeVos and her family contributed millions of dollars to the campaigns of Republican candidates.

title: Did a Dr. Seuss WWII Political Cartoon Criticize America's Isolationism?
subtitle: Theodor Seuss Geisel created a number of biting political cartoons during WWII, including one condemning American indifference to the deaths of foreign children.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A 1940's Dr. Seuss political cartoon criticized Americans for not caring about the deaths of foreign children.

title: Did Mitch McConnell Say One of His Proudest Moments Was Telling Obama 'You Will Not Fill This Supreme Court Vacancy'?
subtitle: A meme contrasted disparate statements by GOP Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on the Senate's duty to confirm Supreme Court nominees.
author: David Emery
statement: In 2016, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said: "One of my proudest moments was when I told Obama, 'You will not fill this Supreme Court vacancy,'" and in 2017, he said, "Apparently there's yet a new standard now, which is not to confirm a Supreme Court nominee at all. I think that's something the American people simply will not tolerate."

title: Did Neil Gorsuch Quote Henry Kissinger in His Yearbook Entry?
subtitle: Some viewers were skeptical about a purported Columbia University yearbook entry for Supreme Court nominee Neil Gorsuch, but the image is genuine.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Neil Gorsuch quoted Henry Kissinger in his Columbial University yearbook entry.

title: Does President Donald Trump's 'Muslim Ban' Exclude Countries Where He Has Businesses?
subtitle: The president had admitted to having "a little conflict of interest" because of a licensing deal in Turkey, but it is not clear whether the countries listed in his immigration executive order were affected by his business interests.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Donald Trump's executive order restricting U.S. travel from predominantly-Muslim nations does not include countries where he has business interests.

title: Did Sean Spicer Retweet a Satirical Onion Video About Himself?
subtitle: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer retweeted The Onion's satirical video about him, leaving some social media users confused.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer retweeted a satirical item from 'The Onion'  about himself.

title: Mike Pence Said Calls to Ban Muslims Are 'Offensive and Unconstitutional'?
subtitle: In a December 2015 tweet, then-Indiana Governor Mike Pence rejected presidential candidate Donald Trump's call to ban Muslims from entering the United States.
author: David Emery
statement: Mike Pence tweeted that calls to ban Muslims from entering the U.S. are "offensive and unconstitutional."

title: Do Farmers Feed Cows Skittles?
subtitle: Cattle diets typically consist of corn, hay, and other plant-based foods, but farmers occasionally do pad their feed with candy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Farmers feed their cattle candy, such as Skittles.

title: Was a Saturday Night Live Writer Suspended Over a Tweet About Barron Trump?
subtitle: SNL Weekend Update writer Katie Rich has been disciplined for tweeting what critics called a distasteful joke about the president's 10-year-old child.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Saturday Night Live writer was suspended for tweeting about Trump's youngest child.

title: Is This Carl Sagan's 'Foreboding of an America'?
subtitle: A quote from a 1995 book by the late astronomer and science communicator Carl Sagan struck a nerve with some readers decades later.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Carl Sagan once speculated about the dangers of a future United States in which “key manufacturing industries have slipped away to other countries”, where people “have lost the ability to set their own agendas or knowledgeably question those in authority” and “no one representing the public interest can even grasp the issues”.

title: Were Escape Kits Smuggled to WWII POWs in Monopoly Games?
subtitle: Escape kits were smuggled to some Allied POWs during World War II by being cleverly concealed in Monopoly game sets.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Maps and other escape aids were smuggled to Allied POWs in Monopoly sets during World War II.

title: National Park Service Twitter Account Shut Down After Anti-Trump Retweets
subtitle: The Department of Interior took action after a tweet was shared via the National Park Service account unfavorably comparing the attendance at Trump's inauguration with that at Obama's.
author: David Emery
statement: Official Department of Interior Twitter accounts were temporarily deactivated after the National Park Service account was used to retweet negative information about the incoming Trump administration.

title: Was Donald Trump's Proposed Re-Election Slogan Used for a 'Purge' Film?
subtitle: Donald Trump's January 2017 assertion that his next campaign slogan would be 'Keep America Great' drew comparisons to a 'Purge' film.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Donald Trump's proposed 2020 re-election campaign slogan ("Keep America Great") was used in a 'Purge' film.

title: Did Two Men Cut off a Dog's Ears?
subtitle: A photograph showing two men standing next to a dog whose ears they had apparently cut off went viral in January 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two men standing next to a dog who had its ears cut off.

title: Did Coretta Scott King Criticize Jeff Sessions' Record?
subtitle: The late civil rights activist wrote in 1986 that appointing Sessions as a federal judge would 'irreparably damage' her husband's work
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Coretta Scott King wrote a letter opposing Jeff Session's confirmation for appointment as a federal judge.

title: Is the Department of Defense Investing in Bullets That Turn into Flowers?
subtitle: The U.S. military is indeed interested in developing bullets that won't leave training ranges environmentally compromised.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The U.S. Army is investigating ways to build biodegradable bullets that will sprout into plants.

title: Hillary Clinton Rated 'Most Admired Woman' More Than Twenty Times
subtitle: Clinton has topped Gallup polls as its most admired woman 21 times.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hillary Clinton has been rated "most admired woman" by Gallup polls 21 times.

title: Did Some Cities in the United States Have 'Ugly Laws' to Keep Disabled People Out of Sight?
subtitle: Chicago, to name one city that enacted an "ugly law," didn't repeal its ordinance banning people deemed "diseased, maimed, mutilated or in any way deformed" from public spaces until 1974.
author: David Emery
statement: During the 19th and 20th centuries, some U.S. cities enacted so-called "ugly laws" banning people deemed "diseased, maimed, mutilated or in any way deformed so as to be an unsightly or disgusting object or improper person" from public spaces.

title: The Unknown Soldiers
subtitle: Sentries guarding the Tomb of the Unknowns remained at their posts during Hurricane Isabel.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Sentries guarding the Tomb of the Unknowns remained at their posts through Hurricane Isabel.

title: Did Meryl Streep Applaud Roman Polanski at the Academy Awards?
subtitle: A video clip showing Meryl Streep applauding for Roman Polanski at the Academy Awards in 2003 came to the forefront after the actress' controversial 2017 Golden Globes speech.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Meryl Streep applauded for Roman Polanski at the Academy Awards in 2003.

title: Did a 1950s TV Episode Feature a Character Named Trump Who Offered to Build a Protective Wall?
subtitle: An episode of the western series 'Trackdown' included a character named Walter Trump who claimed he would build a wall in order to protect a town from the end of the world.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An episode of the 1950s western TV series 'Trackdown' featured a snake oil salesman named 'Trump' who promised to build a wall in order to prevent the end of the world.

title: Wheaties Cereal Sticks to Magnets Because It Contains Iron?
subtitle: Wheaties and other breakfast foods are fortified with iron, which reacts to magnets.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Wheaties cereal sticks to magnets because it has metal flakes.

title: Did a 12-Year-Old Girl Livestream Her Suicide?
subtitle: Authorities are investigating the death of a Polk County, Georgia, girl who livestreamed her suicide.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A 12-year-old girl livestreamed her suicide by hanging.

title: Did 'Express' Use the Male Gender Symbol for a Women's Rights Cover?
subtitle: The Washington Post's free daily newspaper mistakenly used a male gender symbol to illustrate a cover story about women's rights.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Washington Post's free daily newspaper used a male gender symbol to illustrate a cover story about women's rights.

title: Was California's Iconic 'Hollywood' Sign Altered to Read 'Hollyweed'?
subtitle: Pranksters indeed toyed with California's iconic 'Hollywood' sign so that it briefly read "Hollyweed."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pranksters briefly changed California's iconic "Hollywood" sign to read "Hollyweed."

title: Is This a Trump Tower Billboard in Mumbai?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly shows a billboard for Trump Tower in Mumbai with homeless people sleeping in the street beneath it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows an advertisement for Trump Tower in Mumbai stating that there is "only one way to live" installed over a group of homeless people.

title: Burglars Return Stolen Computers to Rape Crisis Center
subtitle: An unexpected show of criminal remorse drew national attention toward a San Bernardino non-profit group.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Burglars returned stolen computers to a group helping rape survivors after realizing whom they'd robbed.

title: Photograph Shows Young Carrie Fisher Watching Debbie Reynolds Perform
subtitle: The image was shared widely on social media after the mother and daughter died within one day of each other.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young Carrie Fisher watching her mother Debbie Reynolds perform onstage.

title: Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources Removes References to 'Climate' from Web Site
subtitle: The Wisconsin DNR's web page was scrubbed of all uses of the word "climate" and altered to imply a lack of consensus about anthropogenic global warming in the scientific community.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources' webpage regarding climate change's potential effects on the Great Lakes was scrubbed of references to the word 'climate'.

title: Is Amazon Gathering Donations for Goodwill?
subtitle: The online retailer is one of several businesses encouraging buyers to use their boxes for charitable donations.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Amazon is taking part in a collection effort for Goodwill.

title: Little Boy's Headstone Removed Because of Single Complaint
subtitle: In 2015, a town council in the U.K. removed a headstone that marked the burial of a 4-year-old boy because its shape was not in keeping with cemetery standards.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A headstone marking the burial site of a 4-year-old boy was removed because its shape violated cemetery rules.

title: CNN and MSNBC in Ratings Freefall, Fox Soundly Beating Both Combined?
subtitle: Fox News is well above both CNN and MSNBC in television viewership and has picked up viewers since the 2016 election.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox News is well above both CNN and MSNBC in television viewership and has increased their lead since the 2016 election.

title: Joan Miro Painting Sold for $37 Million
subtitle: An image of a "child-like" Joan Miro painting was circulated on Facebook along with the claim that it was worth $37 million.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A "child-like" painting by Joan Miro sold for $37 million.

title: Man Found Decapitated and Castrated Behind Walmart Store
subtitle: Albuquerque police said a 42-year-old man was found mutilated on a parking lot median, but not on Walmart's property.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A man was found decapitated and castrated behind a Walmart store.

title: Snowfall in the Sahara
subtitle: Pictures posted by an Algerian photographer showing snow in the hills above the Sahara desert are real.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: On 19 December 2016 an amateur photographer snapped pictures of snow on the ground of the Algerian city of Ain Sefra, which borders the Sahara desert.

title: Trump's Budget Director Pick Asked “Do We Really Need Government-Funded Research at All?”
subtitle: Though it has since been deleted, Mick Mulvaney did pose this question in a Facebook post in response to a scientific study casting doubts on the role of the Zika virus in causing infant microcephaly.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Representative Mick Mulvaney, who was recently selected as the Trump administration's nominee for director of the Office of Management and Budget, one posed the question “Do we really need government-funded research at all?” on Facebook.

title: White Supremacist Web Site Calls for Online Attacks Against Jews in Whitefish, Montana
subtitle: A call to action by the anti-Semitic 'The Daily Stormer' revealed the names and personal contact information of Jewish people they claimed had 'harassed and extorted' the parents of white supremacist Richard Spencer.
author: David Emery
statement: 'The Daily Stormer' called for a retaliatory 'troll storm' against Jews in Whitefish, Montana, whom they accused of causing economic hardship to the parents of white supremacist Richard Spencer.

title: Trump Sends 'Unpresidented' Tweet
subtitle: An 'unpresidented' spelling error in a tweet sent by President-elect Donald Trump on 17 December 2016 quickly went viral.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump sent a tweet with the word "unprecedented" incorrectly spelled "unpresidented."

title: Harvard Professor Wants Electoral College to Reject Trump
subtitle: Law professor Larry Lessig claims that at least twenty Republican electors are considering abandoning the President-elect.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A law professor is working to take Donald Trump's election win away by appealing to electoral college voters.

title: Comcast's Car Crash
subtitle: A YouTube user captured a tense encounter with a Comcast crew - but police said the company was not at fault.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: An Indiana man filmed Comcast Xfinity repairmen causing automobile accidents, then refusing to take responsibility.

title: Driverless Uber Runs Red Light?
subtitle: A video purportedly shows a driverless Uber running a red light in San Francisco.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a driverless Uber running a red light in San Francisco.

title: McDonald's Creates Nutella Burger
subtitle: The fast food chain McDonald's has a new Nutella-filled pastry, but it's available only in Italy.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: McDonald's has a burger filled with Nutella.

title: Did Obama Suggest 'More Flexibility' Toward Russia After the 2012 Election?
subtitle: In 2012, President Obama was overheard over a hot microphone telling President Dmitri Medvedev of Russia he would have "more flexibility" to negotiate with Putin after the election.
author: David Emery
statement: A hot microphone picked up President Obama telling Russian President Dmitri Medvedev he would have more flexibility to negotiate on issues such as missile defense after the 2012 election.

title: Are There More Trees on Earth Than Stars in the Milky Way?
subtitle: Although both figures are rough, a recent estimate for the number of trees on Earth exceeds the highest estimates for the number of stars in the Milky Way.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way galaxy.

title: Nordstrom is Selling a Rock in a Leather Pouch for $85
subtitle: Nordstrom really is selling a rock in a leather pouch for $85 (and a smaller version for $65 for the cost conscious).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Nordstrom sells a rock in a leather pouch for $85, and a smaller version for $65.

title: Highway Plays 'America the Beautiful'
subtitle: A segment of Route 66 in New Mexico plays "America The Beautiful" when it is driven over at a specific speed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A portion of Route 66 in New Mexico plays "America the Beautiful" when you drive over it.

title: Did KFC Create a Chicken-Scented Candle?
subtitle: The fast food chain couldn't help but cluck over their unusual contest giveaway.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Kentucky Fried Chicken created a candle that smells just like its signature dish.

title: Man Punches Kangaroo to Save Dog
subtitle: A viral video showing a man hitting the marsupial has sparked calls for him to be fired from his position as a zookeeper.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A viral video shows a man punching a kangaroo in the face to save his dog.

title: Carrier Still Moving Some Jobs to Mexico Despite Trump Deal
subtitle: A letter from Carrier Corporation to employees in their Indianapolis plant warns that some jobs will still be relocated despite a deal with President-elect Trump.
author: David Emery
statement: Despite an agreement with President-elect Donald Trump to keep 1,000 manufacturing jobs in the U.S., Carrier Corporation says it will still relocate hundreds of jobs to Mexico.

title: Did Senate Dems Vote En Masse to Cut Veterans' Pensions?
subtitle: A conservative meme omits Republican support for a $6 billion cut that affected some military retirees.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Senate Democrats unanimously voted for a bill cutting veterans' pensions.

title: Jeff Sessions Slammed Protections for Disabled Students?
subtitle: During a speech on the Senate floor in 2000, Sessions claimed a federal law that integrates disabled children into mainstream classrooms caused chaos.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Trump's Attorney General pick, Jeff Sessions, blasted a federal law protecting disabled children in the classroom.

title: Can the 25th Amendment Prevent a Trump Presidency?
subtitle: A viral video promoted the idea that Congress could declare him unfit for office.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Congress could declare Donald Trump unfit to govern, thereby preventing him from becoming president.

title: Hillary Clinton Sponsored a Bill to Punish Flag Burning?
subtitle: Yet another controversial tweet from Donald Trump prompted claims that Hillary Clinton once favored punishment for the act.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In 2005, Senator Hillary Clinton co-sponsored a bill to make flag burning a punishable offense.

title: Beef Tallow In New £5 Notes?
subtitle: According to rumors on social media, trace amounts of tallow are present in the UK's new polymer bank notes - making them unsuitable for vegans.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: British £5 notes introduced in 2016 contain traces of beef tallow.

title: Trump Tower Name Changed to 'Dump Tower' In Google Maps
subtitle: A prankster briefly changed the name of Trump Tower, but Google quickly corrected the problem.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A prankster changed the name of Trump Tower to Dump Tower in Google Maps briefly on 26 November 2016.

title: Long-Lost Wedding Ring Found Around Carrot
subtitle: Lena Paahlsson said the ring had been gone for sixteen years before she found it in her garden.
author: Stephanie Larsen
statement: A Swedish woman found a long-lost wedding ring in her carrot garden.

title: Theodore Roosevelt on Criticizing the President
subtitle: A passage attributed to Theodore Roosevelt holds that it is unpatriotic, servile, and morally treasonable to proclaim that there must be no criticism of the President.
author: David Emery
statement: Theodore Roosevelt said that speaking out against criticism of the President "is not only unpatriotic and servile, but is morally treasonable to the American public."

title: Activists Target Big Box Chain Target With Holiday Boycott?
subtitle: Conservative activists angry over the retailer Target's stance on transgender rights have apparently launched a holiday season boycott.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An activist group has launched a holiday-season boycott against chain retailer Target.

title: Video Shows Alt-Right Group Engaging in 'Hail Trump' Salute
subtitle: Video clips of a meeting of the National Policy Institute, a white supremacist/alt-right group, show speaker Richard Spencer leading a Nazi salute.
author: David Emery
statement: Members of the alt-right group the National Policy Institute can be seen on video doing a Nazi-like salute as speaker Richard Spencer calls out "Hail Trump, hail our people, hail victory!"

title: Texas High School Students Fake Trump Assassination
subtitle: Two Texas students were disciplined after writing a skit depicting the assassination of President-elect Trump.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: High school students in Texas were reprimanded for a skit depicting the assassination of President-elect Trump.

title: Producers of 'Hamilton' Issued 'Non-White' Casting Call
subtitle: The Broadway musical "Hamilton," which uses ethnically diverse actors to portray America's founding fathers, has been accused of discriminatory casting.
author: David Emery
statement: The producers of the Broadway musical "Hamilton" issued a casting call specifying "non-white" actors for auditions.

title: Paul Ryan Conducting Obamacare Phone Survey
subtitle: You can give the House Speaker your opinion on the Affordable Care Act - if you're patient.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: House Speaker Paul Ryan is conducting a phone survey regarding experiences with the Affordable Care Act.

title: Global Sea Ice at a Record-Breaking Low
subtitle: An alarming-looking chart of global sea ice coverage is an accurate reflection of the available data, but some scientists argue that it may not be the best way to present it.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Daily sea ice data from 1979 to the present show a record-breaking low amount of global sea ice coverage beginning around October 2016.

title: 'Hamilton' Actor Brandon Victor Dixon Tweets About St. Patrick's Day
subtitle: After Mike Pence was drawn into a controversy related to the musical 'Hamilton,' social media users found and shared an old tweet from actor Brandon Victor Dixon.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 'Hamilton' actor Brandon Victor Dixon sent a controversial tweet in 2012, uncovered after he delivered an on-stage speech to Vice President-Elect Mike Pence.

title: Russian Billboard Features Trump and Putin
subtitle: A photograph shows Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin on a billboard above the words "Let's make the world great again - together."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin on a billboard above the words "Let's make the world great again - together."

title: Harvard Study Confirms Tibetan Monks Can Raise Body Temperature With Their Minds
subtitle: A 1982 study of Tibetan practitioners of "g-tummo" yoga did indeed demonstrate their ability to raise the temperature of different parts of their body.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A Harvard Study showed that Tibetan Monks can significantly raise the temperature of their fingers, toes and other extremities through meditation alone.

title: Did a 1922 Article Advise Not to Worry About Hitler's Anti-Semitism?
subtitle: An early New York Times report about Adolf Hitler woefully misjudged the virulence of his anti-semitism.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A 1922 New York Times article reported that Adolf Hitler “was merely using anti-Semitic propaganda as a bait to catch masses of followers”.

title: Donald Trump Described the Electoral College as a 'Disaster' in 2012
subtitle: In 2012,  Donald Trump tweeted that the electoral college system was a 'disaster for a democracy.'
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Trump blasted the electoral college in 2012.

title: Noam Chomsky Predicted Trump's Presidency?
subtitle: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology linguist and public intellectual seemed to predict the ascendance of Donald Trump in a 2010 interview.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Noam Chomsky predicted the movement that created a Trump presidency.

title: Trump Taps Outspoken Climate Denier To Oversee EPA Transition Team
subtitle: President-elect Trump has selected Myron Ebell, who disputes the scientific consensus around anthropogenic global warming, to lead the EPA transition team.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: President-elect Trump has selected a climate change skeptic to head the team in charge of the transition between Obama and Trump's Environmental Protection Agencies.

title: Canada's Immigration Web Site Crashed After 2016 U.S. Election?
subtitle: Following Donald Trump's surprise electoral landslide, Canada's immigration web site appeared to be overwhelmed by worried Americans.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Americans crashed Canada's immigration web site immediately after Donald Trump was elected.

title: Baltimore Prosecutor Deletes Election Day Ballot Picture
subtitle: Baltimore State's Attorney Marilyn Mosby tweeted, and then deleted, a picture indicating she was voting for Hillary Clinton.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Marilyn Mosby posted (and then deleted) a picture showing her daughter in the ballot booth

title: Did a Catholic Priest Put an Aborted Fetus on an Altar to Promote Republican Candidates?
subtitle: Fr. Frank Pavone said he placed a fetus on the altar ahead of the 2016 presidential election to urge parishioners to cast ballots against Democrats.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Catholic priest placed an aborted fetus on the altar to urge parishioners to vote for Trump.

title: Eric Trump Tweets (Illegal) Ballot Selfie
subtitle: Donald Trump's son, Eric, posted -- and then deleted -- a possibly illegal photograph of his ballot on Twitter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's son, Eric, posted -- and then deleted -- a possibly illegal photograph of his ballot on Twitter.

title: Death Be Not Proud
subtitle: A daughter expressed her not-so-warm feelings about her deceased mother by running a scathing and caustic obituary.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A daughter expressed her not-so-warm feelings about her deceased mother by running a scathing and caustic obituary.

title: Offensive South Carolina Exit Poll
subtitle: A 2014 South Carolina exit poll featured questions many voters found racially offensive.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: South Carolina exit polls asked voters whether black people had become "too demanding" on the subject of civil rights.

title: Arkansas Ballot Typo Puts 'Liar' in Hillary Clinton's Name
subtitle: Hillary Clinton's first name was spelled "Hilliary" on 2016 election ballots printed for use in Lonoke County, Arkansas.
author: David Emery
statement: Hillary Clinton's first name was spelled "Hilliary" on election ballots printed for use in Lonoke County, Arkansas.

title: FBI Announces Inquiry Into Trump Campaign Ties to Russia?
subtitle: NBC reported an inquiry by the FBI into Paul Manafort's foreign business affairs. Months later, the Bureau announced they were investigating Russian collusion.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The FBI announced an inquiry into Russian ties between the Trump campaign and the Russian government.

title: Donna Brazile Leaves CNN After Leaks Reveal Campaign Collusion
subtitle: CNN parted ways with political commentator Donna Brazile after leaked e-mails demonstrated what appeared to be improper collusion with Hillary Clinton's campaign.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donna Brazile was fired from CNN after leaked e-mails suggested she used her position to pass information to the Clinton campaign about upcoming appearances.

title: Are Dogs Really 99.9% Wolf?
subtitle: Domestic dogs split from their wild counterpart, the grey wolf, quite recently by evolutionary timescales.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Dogs and wolves are genetically 99.9% identical.

title: Bill Murray or Tom Hanks?
subtitle: A photograph of actor Bill Murray and a crying child has sparked an internet debate over whether or not it actually shows actor Tom Hanks.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows actor Bill Murray and a crying baby.

title: Seal with Unusual Stripe-Pattern Markings Spotted in Washington
subtitle: A photograph of a ribbon seal spotted in Washington state was snapped by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Association in August 2016.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph captures a rare seal with a symmetrical stripe pattern on its pelt.

title: George H.W. Bush Left a Note for Bill Clinton
subtitle: Outgoing President George H.W. Bush left a supportive note that welcomed incoming President Bill Clinton to the White House in 1993.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Outgoing President George H.W. Bush left a note welcoming incoming President Bill Clinton to the White House in 1993.

title: Trump Says He'll Refuse Salary If Elected President
subtitle: Donald Trump said in 2015 that he would refuse the $400,000 annual president's salary if elected.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump said he would not accept the $400,000 annual president's salary if elected.

title: Did a 1912 Newspaper Article Predict Global Warming?
subtitle: A newspaper clipping from 1912 that anticipates the global warming potential of burning coal is authentic and consistent with the history of climate science.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A 14 August 1912 article from a New Zealand newspaper contained a brief story about how burning coal might produce future warming by adding carbon dioxide to the atmosphere.

title: Did Donald Trump Jr Say 'Women Who Can't Handle Workplace Harassment Shouldn't Work'?
subtitle: The real estate mogul's son asserted on a radio show in 2013 that women who can't handle workplace harassment should teach kindergarten.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump, Jr. said  that if women can't handle harassment in the workplace, they should teach kindergarten.

title: Donald Trump Donated Food, Supplies to Victims of Hurricane Matthew in North Carolina
subtitle: The Trump/Pence campaign delivered $29,000 in food and supplies to Hurricane Matthew victims in three North Carolina towns.
author: David Emery
statement: Donald Trump donated food and supplies to Lumberton, North Carolina, and other towns ravaged by Hurricane Matthew.

title: Robert De Niro 'Went Off' on Donald Trump
subtitle: Actor Robert De Niro was supposed to record an ad for a nonpartisan voter campaign but went off script to lambaste Trump instead.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Actor Robert De Niro blasted Donald Trump in a video meant to encourage people to vote.

title: Melania Trump Wore 'Pussy-Bow' Blouse to Presidential Debate
subtitle: Republican candidate Donald Trump's wife, Melania, wore a blouse style known as "pussy-bow" to the second presidential debate.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Melania Trump wore a "pussy-bow" blouse to the second 2016 presidential debate.

title: Hillary Clinton Buys Weather Channel Ads During Hurricane Matthew?
subtitle: Clinton's campaign responded to negative reports by pulling their Weather Channel ads for the duration of the storm.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hillary Clinton's campaign purchased political ads on the Weather Channel during Hurricane Matthew.

title: New York Television Station Broadcasts Bizarre Warning Before Hoboken Train Crash
subtitle: WKTV participated in a nationwide planned Emergency Alert System test, but a bizarre and unplanned message led to Hoboken train crash conspiracy theories.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The night before a Hoboken train crash, an Upstate New York station aired a bizarre and unsettling Emergency Alert System test warning mentioning trains.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Call the Trans-Pacific Partnership the 'Gold Standard' in Trade Agreements?
subtitle: During the first 2016 presidential debate between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton, the Democratic candidate tried to distance herself from remarks she had previously made about the trade agreement.
author: David Emery
statement: Hillary Clinton once lauded the Trans-Pacific Partnership (which she later opposed) as setting the "gold standard" in trade agreements.

title: Donald Trump: Pregnancy Is an 'Inconvenience' for Businesses
subtitle: During a 2004 interview with NBC's Dateline, Donald Trump said pregnancy is "wonderful" for women but an "inconvenience" for businesses.  Then he denied having said it.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump said that pregnancy is an inconvenience for businesses, then denied having said it.

title: Did Donald Trump Say Not Paying Taxes 'Makes Me Smart'?
subtitle: Donald Trump proclaimed during the first presidential debate of 2016 that not paying federal taxes made him "smart," then denied having said it.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump  proclaimed during the first presidential debate of 2016 that not paying federal taxes made him "smart."

title: Palestinian Terrorist's Wife to Address Clinton Foundation
subtitle: Critics contend the Clinton Foundation "honored" the wife of a "bomb-making terrorist" by inviting award-winning Palestinian educator Hanan al-Hroub to speak at a dinner event.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hanan al-Hroub, whose husband was jailed for providing chemicals used in making bombs that killed Israelis, was invited to speak at a Clinton Global Initiative dinner.

title: 'Rivers of Blood' Flow in Bangladesh After Muslim Festival of Sacrifice
subtitle: Viral images show streets running red with bloody water in parts of Dhaka, Bangladesh, after heavy rains coincided with ritual animal sacrifices on the Muslim holy day of Eid al-Adha.
author: David Emery
statement: The streets in some parts of Dhaka, Bangladesh were awash in bloody water after mass animal sacrifices took place on the Islamic holiday Eid al-Adha.

title: Were Hurricane Katrina 'Looting' Photographs Captioned Differently Based on Race?
subtitle: News photographs alternately described subjects of different races as 'looting' or 'finding' supplies in the wake of Hurricane Katrina.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: News photograph captions described a black man "looting" and a white couple "finding" supplies in the wake of Hurricane Katrina.

title: Is This a Photograph of a Playground from 1900?
subtitle: A grainy historical image shows children climbing on and playing on a frighteningly dangerous (by modern standards) playground of high bars and ladders at a Dallas park.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A black-and-white photograph shows children playing on  frighteningly dangerous (by modern standards)  playground equipment in a public park.

title: 'Haters and Losers'
subtitle: In 2013, Donald Trump extended his best wishes to 'haters and losers' via Twitter on the anniversary of 9/11.
author: Dan Evon
statement: In 2013, Donald Trump extended his best wishes to all, even the "haters and losers," via Twitter on the anniversary of 9/11.

title: 9/11 Tear Drop Memorial
subtitle: Photographs show a New Jersey monument to the victims of 9/11 that was donated by Russia.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a New Jersey monument to the victims of 9/11 that was donated by Russia.

title: Ohio Police Post Graphic Photograph of Adults Passed Out from Heroin with Child in Car
subtitle: East Liverpool, Ohio, police posted a photograph of two adults who were  passed out in their car, reportedly from overdosing on heroin, with a child in the back seat.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph taken by a responding police officer shows a couple passed out in their vehicle from a suspected heroin overdose, with their child in the back seat.

title: 'Star Trek': Words and Music
subtitle: The theme to the original 'Star Trek' television series officially includes never-used lyrics.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The theme to the original 'Star Trek' television includes never-used lyrics.

title: Video Shows Baby Delivered Inside Intact Amniotic Sac
subtitle: A video boasting millions of views on Facebook shows a newborn baby delivered by C-section still inside an intact amniotic sac.
author: David Emery
statement: A viral video shows a newborn baby delivered inside an intact amniotic sac.

title: Did Donald Trump Receive an Ellis Island Award in 1986?
subtitle: It might seem unbelievable to some that Donald Trump could have been considered for an award in celebration of 'patriotism, tolerance, brotherhood and diversity.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump, Muhammad Ali, and Rosa Parks after receiving the Ellis Island Medal of Honor in 1986.

title: Zika Spraying Killed Millions of Bees in South Carolina
subtitle: A government effort to control the spread of the Zika virus via aerial insecticide spray killed of millions of bees in Dorchester County, South Carolina.
author: David Emery
statement: Aerial spraying of an insecticide targeting Zika-carrying mosquitoes in South Carolina resulted in the deaths of millions of bees.

title: Two Editions of 'Wall Street Journal' Bear Opposite Headlines About Trump
subtitle: An image showing two editions of The Wall Street Journal with opposing headlines on the front page is real, but the wording wasn't part of an effort to sway voters.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Wall Street Journal ran Donald Trump stories with opposing headlines on the same day.

title: Colin Kaepernick Wore Socks Depicting Police as Pigs
subtitle: The NFL quarterback's controversial fashion statements continue to raise hackles among fans and foes alike.
author: David Emery
statement: Controversial San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick has worn socks depicting police officers as pigs.

title: Free Krispy Kreme Doughnuts for Pirates on September 19
subtitle: The Krispy Kreme chain is celebrating International Talk Like a Pirate Day with free doughnuts for customers who talk or dress like swashbucklers.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Krispy Kreme is giving free doughnuts to anyone who talks or dresses like a pirate on 19 September 2016.

title: Colin Kaepernick Wears Fidel Castro T-Shirt at Press Conference
subtitle: Controversial NFL quarterback Colin Kaepernick made a "radical chic" fashion choice for a recent television appearance.
author: David Emery
statement: At a press conference, NFL quarterback Colin Kaepernick wore a T-shirt bearing photos of Malcolm X and communist dictator Fidel Castro.

title: John Kerry Suggests Media Cover Terrorism Less
subtitle: Two sentences of John Kerry's remarks in Dhaka on terrorism were highlighted in American media coverage of his comments, but didn't tell the entire story.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: John Kerry suggested that the media cover acts of terrorism less often, and perhaps people might not "know what's going on."

title: Pokémon Go Developer Niantic to Develop 'Harry Potter Go'?
subtitle: A rumor that the company that created Pokémon Go was launching a Harry Potter-themed version of the game was a hoax in 2014, but reality in 2017.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pokémon Go developer Niantic is working on a Harry Potter version of the hugely popular augmented-reality game.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Praying Mantis Attacking a Hummingbird?
subtitle: An image of a hummingbird killed by a praying mantis is real, although what the picture captures is a relatively rare event.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a praying mantis after it killed a hummingbird.

title: CNN Took 'Crooked' Out of Trump Tweet About Clinton
subtitle: CNN dropped the word "crooked" from a graphic quoting a Donald Trump tweet about his rival's health.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: CNN showed an altered version of a tweet written by Donald Trump during a news segment.

title: Jackie Robinson: 'I Cannot Stand and Sing the Anthem. I Cannot Salute the Flag'
subtitle: African-American baseball pioneer Jackie Robinson wrote in his autobiography that he couldn't sing the anthem or salute the flag because "I know that I am a black man in a white world."
author: David Emery
statement: Baseball player Jackie Robinson said, "I cannot stand and sing the anthem. I cannot salute the flag; I know that I am a black man in a white world."

title: Hillary Clinton Failed D.C. Bar Exam
subtitle: Hillary Rodham did not succeed in her 1973 attempt to pass the District of Columbia bar exam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Rodham failed her 1973 attempt to pass the District of Columbia bar exam.

title: The Boy Who Harnessed the Wind
subtitle: The story of William Kamkwamba, aka "The Boy Who Harnessed the Wind," is true, but it isn't new and has been extensively covered in the media.
author: David Emery
statement: Based on information he learned from library books, school drop-out William Kamkwamba built a windmill out of scrap parts and brought electricity to his village in Malawi.

title: Rush Limbaugh: Obama Sending Lesbian Farmers to Invade Red States
subtitle: Conservative radio pundit Rush Limbaugh railed against what he described as an Obama administration plot to pay lesbians to become farmers and invade conservative rural strongholds.
author: David Emery
statement: Rush Limbaugh accused President Obama and the Democrats of recruiting lesbian farmers to "attack" conservative rural areas of the U.S.

title: Did LBJ Advocate: 'Convince the Lowest White Man He's Better Than the Best Colored Man'?
subtitle: President Lyndon Baines Johnson, who grew up in the South and understood the politics of racism from the inside, saw it in part as a ploy to divide and conquer.
author: David Emery
statement: President Lyndon B. Johnson once said, "If you can convince the lowest white man he's better than the best colored man, he won't notice you're picking his pocket. Hell, give him somebody to look down on, and he'll empty his pockets for you."

title: Trump Family Photograph
subtitle: A family portrait of Donald Trump, his wife Melania, and son Barron appeared in August 2016, but some viewers were skeptical of its authenticity.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a real portrait of Donald Trump and his family.

title: KFC Extra Crispy Sunscreen
subtitle: Many consumers were confused by KFC's Extra Crispy Sunscreen promotion, but it was (briefly) a real product.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A KFC promotion offered Extra Crispy Sunscreen to consumers.

title: Donald Trump's 'Nuclear' Speech
subtitle: A rambling, jumbled portion of a Donald Trump speech from July 2016 amused and stunned social media users.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A tweet reproduces a 90-second long sentence from a Donald Trump speech.

title: Fear the Grim Arabic Tote Bag
subtitle: A viral image of a tote bag with an Arabic inscription is correctly translated, poking fun at non-speakers frightened of the language.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A tote bag bears a slogan poking fun at people who fear Arabic writing.

title: 'Perfect Timing' Gymnastics Shot
subtitle: A GIF shows a photographer's 'perfect timing,' setting off a camera's flash just as a gymnast performed a midair split.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A GIF shows a photographer's 'perfect timing,' setting off a camera's flash just as a gymnast performed a midair split.

title: Hillary Clinton Sexual Assault Page Edited to Remove 'Right to be Believed'?
subtitle: A page about campus sexual assault on Hillary Clinton's campaign web site once included a reference to a victim's right to be believed, but the wording was removed in early 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A page on Hillary Clinton's campaign web site about campus sexual assault was edited to remove wording about a victim's "right to be believed."

title: Third Apple Co-Founder Sold Share Now Worth Billions for $800
subtitle: Ron Wayne was the third co-founder of Apple Computer, but he soon sold his 10% share in the company for a mere $800.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Ron Wayne was a third Apple co-founder, who in 1976 sold his 10% share in the company for $800

title: The Strange Death of Elisa Lam
subtitle: A young woman named Elisa Lam disappeared under mysterious circumstances in Los Angeles in 2013, her body later found in a hotel's rooftop water tank.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A young woman named Elisa Lam disappeared under mysterious circumstances in Los Angeles, her body later found in a hotel's water tank.

title: Did a Man Die Demonstrating a Window's Strength?
subtitle: A Toronto lawyer demonstrating the safety of window panes in a skyscraper ironically plunged through a window to his death.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A Toronto lawyer demonstrating the safety of window panes in a skyscraper plunged through a window to his death.

title: Were Homeowners Encouraged to Burn Batteries to Prevent Chimney Soot?
subtitle: Magazine tips advised readers to burn batteries in the fireplace in order to prevent soot formation and produce colorful flames.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a magazine DIY tip from the 1950s instructing readers to burn zinc batteries in the fireplace in order to prevent soot formation and produce colorful flames is real.

title: Fifty Former National Security Officials Disavow Trump in Formal Statement
subtitle: On 8 August 2016, fifty Republicans who formerly held positions in national security signed an open letter vowing not to vote for Donald Trump.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Fifty Republican former national security officials issued an open letter affirming they would not vote for Donald Trump and deeming him dangerously unqualified.

title: Hillary Clinton Referenced RFK Assassination as Reason to Continue 2008 Campaign
subtitle: A Hillary Clinton quote from 2008 about the assassination of RFK resurfaced in 2016, but Clinton didn't escape criticism over the comment at the time she made it.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton cited Robert F. Kennedy's June 1968 assassination as a reason to remain in the presidential race against Barack Obama in 2008.

title: John F. Kennedy Donated His Entire Presidential Salary to Charity
subtitle: President Kennedy not only gave all his presidential salary to charity, but his congressional salary as well.  And he could well afford to.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President John F. Kennedy donated his entire presidential salary to charity.

title: Florida Officer Mistakes Donut Glaze for Methampetamines
subtitle: Orlando resident Daniel Rushing was cleared of suspected drug possession by the lab weeks after his arrest.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A man was arrested after sugar from his Krispy Kreme donuts tested positive for methamphetamine during a traffic stop.

title: The Rolling Stones' Rice Krispies Jingle
subtitle: The often-controversial rock group penned and performed a catchy song for a 1964 cereal commercial.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The Rolling Stones recorded a jingle for Rice Krispies in 1964.

title: For All Jews Voting for Hillary
subtitle: A photograph shows the Clintons posing with Palestinian leader Yasser Arafat.  But what's the point?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows the Clintons posing with Palestinian leader Yasser Arafat.

title: Is the Green Party on the Ballot in All 50 States?
subtitle: As of September 2016, Jill Stein was on the ballot in 45 states.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Jill Stein, the Green Part's presidential candidate, is not yet on the ballot in every state.

title: Always a Bridesmaid, Never a Bride
subtitle: Common usage of the phrase "Always a bridesmaid but never a bride" originated with an advertising campaign for Listerine brand mouthwash.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Common usage of the phrase "Always a bridesmaid but never a bride" originated with an advertising campaign for Listerine mouthwash.

title: Hillary Clinton: 'Marriage Is Always Between a Man and a Woman'
subtitle: An image about Hillary Clinton's stance on marriage equality reflects that she didn't publicly support same-sex marriage until 2013.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton said in 2000 that she believed marriage was "always between a man and a woman."

title: So Long and Thanks for All the Fish
subtitle: A photograph of an orca jumping several feet out of the water is often viewed with skepticism, but it's real.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an orca leaping several feet out of the water.

title: Disney's 'Tower of Terror' Being Replaced with 'Guardians of the Galaxy'
subtitle: After an earlier spurious rumor about the fate of Disney's "Tower of Terror,"  the company confirmed they are replacing the ride with a "Guardians of the Galaxy" attraction in California.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Disney is replacing the "Tower of Terror" attraction with a "Guardians of the Galaxy" themed ride at their Disney California Adventure Park.

title: Protester Screams in NYPD Cop's Face
subtitle: Award-winning photograph captures a protester right up against an NYPD officer, but whether she was actually screaming in his face is uncertain.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a protester face-to-face with an NYPD officer.

title: Netflix CEO: 'Trump Would Destroy Much of What Is Great About America'
subtitle: Netflix CEO Reed Hastings said that Donald Trump 'would destroy much of what is great about America' and 'it's important that Trump lose by a landslide.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix CEO Reed Hastings said that Donald Trump 'would destroy much of what is great about America.'

title: Donald Trump Jr.: Our Greenskeeper Skipped His Sister's Wedding
subtitle: Donald Trump's son said that the family's greenskeeper missed his own sister's wedding in order to work for the Trumps.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Donald Trump Jr. tweeted that the family's greenskeeper missed his own sister's wedding in order to work for the Trumps.

title: Pokémon Enthusiast Stabbed, Turns Down Medical Treatment to Keep Playing
subtitle: A story about a very enthusiastic Pokémon GO player in Forest Grove, Oregon may have seemed like satire - but it wasn't.
author: Brooke Binkowski

title: Church Explosion Spares Choir
subtitle: When a Nebraska church exploded in 1950, no one was injured because every single member of the choir was coincidentally late in arriving for practice that evening.
author: Snopes Staff

title: Did the Selective Service Harvest Names from a 'Free Ice Cream' List?
subtitle: A pair of brothers were surprised when the fictitious name they made up for a free yearly ice cream list received a Selective Service registration notice.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A few years after a couple of kids used a made-up name to sign up for a free yearly ice cream cone, they received a Selective Service registration notice for their non-existent friend.

title: Tug of War Dismemberment
subtitle: A photograph shows the aftermath of a grisly tug-of-war contest in which two men lost their arms.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows the aftermath of a grisly tug-of-war contest in which two men lost their arms.

title: Has 'Song of the South' Never Been Released on Home Video in the US?
subtitle: The NAACP has decried "the impression [the 1946 film] gives of an idyllic master-slave relationship."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The film "Song of the South" has never been released on home video in the USA.

title: America Sings Death
subtitle: Was a Disneyland cast member crushed to death in America Sings?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A hostess working the America Sings attraction was crushed to death by a rotating wall.
